texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: INTRODUCTION
texts.text: INTRODUCTION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This manual is designed for the Medication Assistance Supervising (MAS) RN/ LPNs who will train Medication Assistance Certified (MAC) Workers at the agency level. This manual, in addition to the MAC II PowerPoint presentation, provides instructions on training requirements set forth by the Alabama Department of Mental Health (ADMH) and the Alabama Board of Nursing (ABN). The MAC training program has clinical and medico-legal significance. The MAC training program is essential to assuring MAC Workers are competent but also protects the delegating MAS Nurse against potential liability.
texts.text: This manual is designed for the Medication Assistance Supervising (MAS) RN/ LPNs who will train Medication Assistance Certified (MAC) Workers at the agency level. This manual, in addition to the MAC II PowerPoint presentation, provides instructions on training requirements set forth by the Alabama Department of Mental Health (ADMH) and the Alabama Board of Nursing (ABN). The MAC training program has clinical and medico-legal significance. The MAC training program is essential to assuring MAC Workers are competent but also protects the delegating MAS Nurse against potential liability.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The goal of the MAC training program is to provide safe and accurate assistance with medication administration and other nursing tasks that may be delegated by the MAS Nurse. Proper execution of the MAC training program signifies that the MAS Nurse has adhered to the requirements set forth by the ADMH and ABN for training MAC Workers.
texts.text: The goal of the MAC training program is to provide safe and accurate assistance with medication administration and other nursing tasks that may be delegated by the MAS Nurse. Proper execution of the MAC training program signifies that the MAS Nurse has adhered to the requirements set forth by the ADMH and ABN for training MAC Workers.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The academic skills of non-licensed persons (MAC Workers) will range from a high school diploma or equivalent to advanced college degrees.
texts.text: The academic skills of non-licensed persons (MAC Workers) will range from a high school diploma or equivalent to advanced college degrees.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Many non-licensed professionals have a limited understanding of normal brain function, mental disorders, and some physical disorders.
texts.text: Many non-licensed professionals have a limited understanding of normal brain function, mental disorders, and some physical disorders.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Unlicensed professionals may have issues related to stigma. The MAS Nurse shall address these issues and any concerns of the unlicensed professional(s) during the training program.
texts.text: Unlicensed professionals may have issues related to stigma. The MAS Nurse shall address these issues and any concerns of the unlicensed professional(s) during the training program.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse must read the Quick Facts for MAC's Manual , in addition to this manual and the accompanying PowerPoint presentation. The MAS Nurse shall also complete the six MAC I elearning modules. The MAS Nurse must understand the symptoms and management of common mental disorders, physical disorders, and medications. The MAS Nurse must understand that NDP guidelines incorporate state laws related to medication, health, safety, and provision of care for people served through ADMH. The guidelines include regulations set forth by the ABN, ADMH Service Division Regulations, Alabama Board of Pharmacy (ABP), Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH), Department of Human Resources (DHR), as well as OSHA, CDC, FDA, and Medicaid Standards.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse must read the Quick Facts for MAC's Manual , in addition to this manual and the accompanying PowerPoint presentation. The MAS Nurse shall also complete the six MAC I elearning modules. The MAS Nurse must understand the symptoms and management of common mental disorders, physical disorders, and medications. The MAS Nurse must understand that NDP guidelines incorporate state laws related to medication, health, safety, and provision of care for people served through ADMH. The guidelines include regulations set forth by the ABN, ADMH Service Division Regulations, Alabama Board of Pharmacy (ABP), Alabama Department of Public Health (ADPH), Department of Human Resources (DHR), as well as OSHA, CDC, FDA, and Medicaid Standards.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse has the responsibility to determine if the MAC candidate is competent to function independently as a MAC Worker. MAC certification requires the following five items:
texts.text: The MAS Nurse has the responsibility to determine if the MAC candidate is competent to function independently as a MAC Worker. MAC certification requires the following five items:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS nurse must verify MAC candidate has a high school diploma/college transcript or GED
texts.text: MAS nurse must verify MAC candidate has a high school diploma/college transcript or GED

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful completion of the six MAC I e-learning modules as evidenced by certificates/transcript of completion for each module.
texts.text: Successful completion of the six MAC I e-learning modules as evidenced by certificates/transcript of completion for each module.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A minimum of eight hours of face-to-face contact (may extend hours if needed) with the MAC candidate should allow time to determine competency.
texts.text: A minimum of eight hours of face-to-face contact (may extend hours if needed) with the MAC candidate should allow time to determine competency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful evaluation of skills competency (for all nursing tasks delegated using Skills Checklist - NDP 13) by a MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Successful evaluation of skills competency (for all nursing tasks delegated using Skills Checklist - NDP 13) by a MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Decision by a MAS Nurse to sign the delegation form with the MAC Worker.
texts.text: Decision by a MAS Nurse to sign the delegation form with the MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: During the MAC II training, the MAS Nurse may choose to emphasize disorders prevalent at their agency. Many persons with mental disorders receive psychotropic medications. Information regarding common medications, metabolic, and other comorbid problems should be included in the training. Any information added shall not contradict facts included in the MAC training program curriculum.
texts.text: During the MAC II training, the MAS Nurse may choose to emphasize disorders prevalent at their agency. Many persons with mental disorders receive psychotropic medications. Information regarding common medications, metabolic, and other comorbid problems should be included in the training. Any information added shall not contradict facts included in the MAC training program curriculum.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MAC II must be taught by a MAS Nurse (MAS RN/MAS LPN) whose competency has been validated as evidenced by a current certificate of training. The eight hours may be broken into blocks of time equaling eight hours according to agency need and MAS Nurse availability/preference. Once MAC I training is completed, MAC II must be completed within ninety (90) days .  If Direct Care Worker comes to the agency with MAC I training it should be completed 90 days from the hire date .  Training should occur in a supervised environment that is conducive to learning (free of interruptions). Specifically, discuss each learning objective and be sure each objective is met by the MAC candidates.
texts.text: MAC II must be taught by a MAS Nurse (MAS RN/MAS LPN) whose competency has been validated as evidenced by a current certificate of training. The eight hours may be broken into blocks of time equaling eight hours according to agency need and MAS Nurse availability/preference. Once MAC I training is completed, MAC II must be completed within ninety (90) days .  If Direct Care Worker comes to the agency with MAC I training it should be completed 90 days from the hire date .  Training should occur in a supervised environment that is conducive to learning (free of interruptions). Specifically, discuss each learning objective and be sure each objective is met by the MAC candidates.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse shall use the current PowerPoint presentation, Quick Facts for MAC's Manual, and clinical vignettes of the people served who will be receiving care from the MAC Worker. The use of past situations to highlight issues related to problem-solving is encouraged.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall use the current PowerPoint presentation, Quick Facts for MAC's Manual, and clinical vignettes of the people served who will be receiving care from the MAC Worker. The use of past situations to highlight issues related to problem-solving is encouraged.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAC training program curriculum was developed by a team of nurses, physicians, pharmacists, other ADMH staff, and community providers. All training information is submitted to the ABN for review and approval annually. All practices and guidelines outlined in this manual comply with the existing ABN, ABP, and ADMH regulations.
texts.text: The MAC training program curriculum was developed by a team of nurses, physicians, pharmacists, other ADMH staff, and community providers. All training information is submitted to the ABN for review and approval annually. All practices and guidelines outlined in this manual comply with the existing ABN, ABP, and ADMH regulations.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MAS Nurses and MAC workers must maintain a current certificate to maintain compliance with the NDP and ADMH Certification. All training Certificates have a 90-day grace period to renew after the expiration date on the certificate . This includes the skills check list.
texts.text: MAS Nurses and MAC workers must maintain a current certificate to maintain compliance with the NDP and ADMH Certification. All training Certificates have a 90-day grace period to renew after the expiration date on the certificate . This includes the skills check list.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse must explain the importance of the responsibility associated with assisting with medications as well as other delegated nursing tasks. The humanity of persons served through the ADMH programs must be emphasized.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse must explain the importance of the responsibility associated with assisting with medications as well as other delegated nursing tasks. The humanity of persons served through the ADMH programs must be emphasized.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Every MAC Worker must have access to a copy of the Quick Facts for MAC's Manual to be used by the MAC Worker throughout their employment.
texts.text: Every MAC Worker must have access to a copy of the Quick Facts for MAC's Manual to be used by the MAC Worker throughout their employment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Intellectual Disabilities (ID)/Developmental Disabilities (DD) are a term used when there are limits to a person's ability to learn and function at an expected level.
texts.text: Intellectual Disabilities (ID)/Developmental Disabilities (DD) are a term used when there are limits to a person's ability to learn and function at an expected level.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · In addition to the IQ of a person, the ability to function day to day or the ability to adapt behaviors is considered when determining the degree of disability.
texts.text: In addition to the IQ of a person, the ability to function day to day or the ability to adapt behaviors is considered when determining the degree of disability.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The information covered in this section is reference information for the MAS Nurse. This information provides an overview of the principles of the delegation including the American Nurses Association (ANA) Policy Statement and Practice Strategies.
texts.text: The information covered in this section is reference information for the MAS Nurse. This information provides an overview of the principles of the delegation including the American Nurses Association (ANA) Policy Statement and Practice Strategies.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Alabama Board of Nursing (ABON) Nurse Practice Act states:
texts.text: The Alabama Board of Nursing (ABON) Nurse Practice Act states:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation refers to the decision by a MAS trained/to sign the delegation form that allows a MAC Worker to assist with the administration of medication.
texts.text: Delegation refers to the decision by a MAS trained/to sign the delegation form that allows a MAC Worker to assist with the administration of medication.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Nurse Practice Act (NPA) is the legal authority for nursing practice in each state. According to the ANA Principles for Delegation, RNs are accountable to the public for providing culturally competent, safe, and effective nursing care for persons. RNs function as essential members of health  care  teams  that  include  the  person  and  may  include  other  licensed  professionals  and paraprofessionals as well as assistive health care workers and informal caregivers.
texts.text: The Nurse Practice Act (NPA) is the legal authority for nursing practice in each state. According to the ANA Principles for Delegation, RNs are accountable to the public for providing culturally competent, safe, and effective nursing care for persons. RNs function as essential members of health  care  teams  that  include  the  person  and  may  include  other  licensed  professionals  and paraprofessionals as well as assistive health care workers and informal caregivers.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: RNs are  accountable  for  supervising  those  to  whom  they  have  delegated  tasks.  RNs  often delegate nursing tasks to other team members, and they are accountable for the decision to delegate and for the adequacy of nursing care to the person. The retains accountability for the outcome of delegation.
texts.text: RNs are  accountable  for  supervising  those  to  whom  they  have  delegated  tasks.  RNs  often delegate nursing tasks to other team members, and they are accountable for the decision to delegate and for the adequacy of nursing care to the person. The retains accountability for the outcome of delegation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The nursing tasks or activities that may be performed by the nursing team, which may include nursing assistive personnel and other health care workers such as s under the direction of an RN, are identified according to legal parameters defined by each state in its nurse practice act and by the scope of practice and standards established by professional nursing organizations. Thus, the framework for clinical practice including delegation is determined by individual state statutes, state regulations, and policy statements and by generally accepted professional nursing standards of practice.
texts.text: The nursing tasks or activities that may be performed by the nursing team, which may include nursing assistive personnel and other health care workers such as s under the direction of an RN, are identified according to legal parameters defined by each state in its nurse practice act and by the scope of practice and standards established by professional nursing organizations. Thus, the framework for clinical practice including delegation is determined by individual state statutes, state regulations, and policy statements and by generally accepted professional nursing standards of practice.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Today's challenges make greater demands on s to have the knowledge and critical thinking skills to effectively delegate to others. These challenges include the varying experience levels of  s,  the  increasing  use  of  assistive  personnel,  and  the  time  required  to  safely  monitor  and supervise the assistive personnel and the delegated work.
texts.text: Today's challenges make greater demands on s to have the knowledge and critical thinking skills to effectively delegate to others. These challenges include the varying experience levels of  s,  the  increasing  use  of  assistive  personnel,  and  the  time  required  to  safely  monitor  and supervise the assistive personnel and the delegated work.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: With the nursing shortage, inexperienced nurses are more likely to be placed in a  position of having  to  supervise  others  without  sufficient  mentoring.  Inconsistent  facility  or  agency expectations regarding assistive personnel duties coupled with minimal training can lead to an unstable and less qualified workforce. Sicker s, the increased use of technology, and the need to administer medications  place  them in  a position of juggling delivery of  care with  overseeing delegated work. (Principles of Delegation, ANA 2005)
texts.text: With the nursing shortage, inexperienced nurses are more likely to be placed in a  position of having  to  supervise  others  without  sufficient  mentoring.  Inconsistent  facility  or  agency expectations regarding assistive personnel duties coupled with minimal training can lead to an unstable and less qualified workforce. Sicker s, the increased use of technology, and the need to administer medications  place  them in  a position of juggling delivery of  care with  overseeing delegated work. (Principles of Delegation, ANA 2005)

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Policy Statements
texts.text: Policy Statements

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The authority for the practice of nursing is based on a social contract that acknowledges professional  rights  and  responsibilities  as  well  as  mechanisms  for  public  accountability.' (Nursing's Social Policy Statement, ANA 2003)
texts.text: 'The authority for the practice of nursing is based on a social contract that acknowledges professional  rights  and  responsibilities  as  well  as  mechanisms  for  public  accountability.' (Nursing's Social Policy Statement, ANA 2003)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Society grants the professions authority over functions vital to itself and permits them considerable autonomy in the conduct of their affairs. In return, the professionals are expected to act responsibly, always mindful of the public trust. Self-regulation to assure quality in performance is at the heart of this relationship. It is the authentic hallmark of a mature profession.' (Donabedian, 1976)
texts.text: 'Society grants the professions authority over functions vital to itself and permits them considerable autonomy in the conduct of their affairs. In return, the professionals are expected to act responsibly, always mindful of the public trust. Self-regulation to assure quality in performance is at the heart of this relationship. It is the authentic hallmark of a mature profession.' (Donabedian, 1976)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The RN takes responsibility and accountability for individual nursing practice and determines the appropriate delegation of tasks consistent with the nurse's obligation to provide optimum care'. (Code of Ethics for nurses with Interpretive Statements, ANA 2001)
texts.text: 'The RN takes responsibility and accountability for individual nursing practice and determines the appropriate delegation of tasks consistent with the nurse's obligation to provide optimum care'. (Code of Ethics for nurses with Interpretive Statements, ANA 2001)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The RN assigns or delegates tasks based on the needs and condition of the person, the potential for harm, stability of the person's condition, the complexity of the task, predictability of the outcome, and abilities of the staff to whom the task is delegated.' (Nursing Scope and Standards of Practice, ANA 2003)
texts.text: 'The RN assigns or delegates tasks based on the needs and condition of the person, the potential for harm, stability of the person's condition, the complexity of the task, predictability of the outcome, and abilities of the staff to whom the task is delegated.' (Nursing Scope and Standards of Practice, ANA 2003)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The profession defines the scope and standards of nursing practice. State nurse practice acts define the legal parameters for nursing practice, which include delegation.' (Principles of Delegation, ANA 2005)
texts.text: 'The profession defines the scope and standards of nursing practice. State nurse practice acts define the legal parameters for nursing practice, which include delegation.' (Principles of Delegation, ANA 2005)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'All decisions related to delegation and assignments are based on the fundamental principles of protection of the health, safety, and welfare of the public.' (Joint Statement on Delegation, ANA & NCSBN 2005)
texts.text: 'All decisions related to delegation and assignments are based on the fundamental principles of protection of the health, safety, and welfare of the public.' (Joint Statement on Delegation, ANA & NCSBN 2005)

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Principles
texts.text: Principles

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The following principles have remained constant since the early 1950s:
texts.text: The following principles have remained constant since the early 1950s:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Overarching Principles
texts.text: Overarching Principles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The nursing profession determines the scope of nursing practice.
texts.text: The nursing profession determines the scope of nursing practice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The nursing profession defines and supervises the education, training, and utilization of any assistant roles involved in providing direct care.
texts.text: The nursing profession defines and supervises the education, training, and utilization of any assistant roles involved in providing direct care.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN takes responsibility and accountability for the provision of nursing practice.
texts.text: The MAS RN takes responsibility and accountability for the provision of nursing practice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN directs care and determines the appropriate utilization of any assistant involved in providing direct care.
texts.text: The MAS RN directs care and determines the appropriate utilization of any assistant involved in providing direct care.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN accepts aid from nursing assistive personnel in providing nursing care for the person.
texts.text: The MAS RN accepts aid from nursing assistive personnel in providing nursing care for the person.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Nurse-related Principles
texts.text: Nurse-related Principles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN may delegate elements of care but does not delegate the nursing process itself.
texts.text: The MAS RN may delegate elements of care but does not delegate the nursing process itself.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN has the duty to answer for personal actions relating to the nursing process.
texts.text: The MAS RN has the duty to answer for personal actions relating to the nursing process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse considers the knowledge and skills of any individual to whom the MAS Nurse may delegate elements of care.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse considers the knowledge and skills of any individual to whom the MAS Nurse may delegate elements of care.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The decision of whether to delegate or assign is based upon the MAS RN's judgment concerning the condition of the person, the competence of all members of the nursing team, and the degree of supervision that will be required of the MAS Nurse if a task is delegated.
texts.text: The decision of whether to delegate or assign is based upon the MAS RN's judgment concerning the condition of the person, the competence of all members of the nursing team, and the degree of supervision that will be required of the MAS Nurse if a task is delegated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse delegates only those tasks for which he/she believes the other health care worker has the knowledge and skill to perform, taking into consideration training, cultural competence, experience, and facility/agency policies and procedures.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse delegates only those tasks for which he/she believes the other health care worker has the knowledge and skill to perform, taking into consideration training, cultural competence, experience, and facility/agency policies and procedures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse uses critical thinking and professional judgment when following the Five Rights of Delegation:
texts.text: The MAS Nurse uses critical thinking and professional judgment when following the Five Rights of Delegation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Right task
texts.text: o Right task

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Right circumstances
texts.text: o Right circumstances

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Right person
texts.text: o Right person

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Right directions and communication
texts.text: o Right directions and communication

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Right supervision and evaluation
texts.text: o Right supervision and evaluation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The  MAS  RN  acknowledges  that  there  is  a  relational  aspect  to  the  delegation  and  that communication is culturally appropriate and the person receiving the communication is treated respectfully. Chief nursing officers are accountable for establishing systems to assess, mentor, verify and communicate ongoing competence requirements in areas related to delegation, both for MAS RNs and delegates.
texts.text: The  MAS  RN  acknowledges  that  there  is  a  relational  aspect  to  the  delegation  and  that communication is culturally appropriate and the person receiving the communication is treated respectfully. Chief nursing officers are accountable for establishing systems to assess, mentor, verify and communicate ongoing competence requirements in areas related to delegation, both for MAS RNs and delegates.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS RNs monitor organizational policies, procedures, and position descriptions to ensure there  is  no  violation  of  the  nurse  practice  act,  working  with  the  state  board  of  nursing  as necessary.
texts.text: MAS RNs monitor organizational policies, procedures, and position descriptions to ensure there  is  no  violation  of  the  nurse  practice  act,  working  with  the  state  board  of  nursing  as necessary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Organization-related Principles
texts.text: Organization-related Principles

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization is accountable for delegation through the allocation of resources to ensure sufficient staffing so that the MAS RN can delegate appropriately.
texts.text: The organization is accountable for delegation through the allocation of resources to ensure sufficient staffing so that the MAS RN can delegate appropriately.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization is accountable for documenting competencies for all staff providing direct care and for ensuring that the MAS RN has access to competency information for all nurses, staff, managers, and administrators.
texts.text: The organization is accountable for documenting competencies for all staff providing direct care and for ensuring that the MAS RN has access to competency information for all nurses, staff, managers, and administrators.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The organization ensures that the educational needs of nursing assistive personnel are met through the implementation of a system that allows for nurse input.
texts.text: The organization ensures that the educational needs of nursing assistive personnel are met through the implementation of a system that allows for nurse input.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Organizations have policies in place that allow input from nurses indicating that delegation is a professional right and responsibility.
texts.text: Organizations have policies in place that allow input from nurses indicating that delegation is a professional right and responsibility.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Practice Strategies
texts.text: Practice Strategies

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The following practice strategies form the basis of safe and effective delegation:
texts.text: The following practice strategies form the basis of safe and effective delegation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · All nurses are knowledgeable about the principles of delegation, associated risks and benefits, state laws, and ALL state regulations governing their practice. In reviewing the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, MAS RNs must ask the following questions:
texts.text: All nurses are knowledgeable about the principles of delegation, associated risks and benefits, state laws, and ALL state regulations governing their practice. In reviewing the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, MAS RNs must ask the following questions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act permit delegation?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act permit delegation?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ What is the definition of delegation in Alabama?
texts.text: What is the definition of delegation in Alabama?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act also authorize specific tasks for delegation?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act also authorize specific tasks for delegation?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act list tasks that cannot be delegated, or does it authorize the MAS Nurse to delegate based upon certain circumstances?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act list tasks that cannot be delegated, or does it authorize the MAS Nurse to delegate based upon certain circumstances?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act include a description of the MAC Worker's role?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act include a description of the MAC Worker's role?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Is there a specific definition of supervision in the nurse practice act?
texts.text: Is there a specific definition of supervision in the nurse practice act?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ How does Alabama define supervision or direction when delegating to another healthcare?
texts.text: How does Alabama define supervision or direction when delegating to another healthcare?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act indicate the consequences of inappropriate delegation?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act indicate the consequences of inappropriate delegation?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Does the nurse practice act provide guidelines for reducing delegation risks?
texts.text: Does the nurse practice act provide guidelines for reducing delegation risks?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ What is the legal scope of practice for a MAS LPN in Alabama?
texts.text: What is the legal scope of practice for a MAS LPN in Alabama?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ What other healthcare worker roles, if any, are regulated by the state or Nurse Practice Act?
texts.text: What other healthcare worker roles, if any, are regulated by the state or Nurse Practice Act?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ How are other roles regulated in relation to the MAS RN role? All nurses work together to create effective policies for personal care assignments for staff, delegation, and clinical supervision of team members.
texts.text: How are other roles regulated in relation to the MAS RN role? All nurses work together to create effective policies for personal care assignments for staff, delegation, and clinical supervision of team members.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Nurses understand professional standards of practice as well as the legal parameters for practice.
texts.text: Nurses understand professional standards of practice as well as the legal parameters for practice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Clear, concise job descriptions are developed for each team member , and the NDP Coordinator should be consulted if questions arise regarding the appropriateness of delegating Nursing activities.
texts.text: Clear, concise job descriptions are developed for each team member , and the NDP Coordinator should be consulted if questions arise regarding the appropriateness of delegating Nursing activities.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The profession's foundational documents, including Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements, Nursing: Scope and Standards of Practice, and Nursing's Social Policy Statement, Second Edition ; as well as the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, and other regulatory documents or position statements regarding the role of the MAS RNs assigning care and delegating tasks are available online for all nursing staff.
texts.text: The profession's foundational documents, including Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements, Nursing: Scope and Standards of Practice, and Nursing's Social Policy Statement, Second Edition ; as well as the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, and other regulatory documents or position statements regarding the role of the MAS RNs assigning care and delegating tasks are available online for all nursing staff.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS RNs educate  organizational  leadership  and  risk  management  staff  on  the  process, education, and training limitations of MAS LPNs, MAC Workers, and other healthcare workers as well as the legal responsibilities of MAS RNs who delegate tasks.
texts.text: MAS RNs educate  organizational  leadership  and  risk  management  staff  on  the  process, education, and training limitations of MAS LPNs, MAC Workers, and other healthcare workers as well as the legal responsibilities of MAS RNs who delegate tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Language regarding MAS RN liability related to delegation is included in Alabama Nurse Practice Act.
texts.text: Language regarding MAS RN liability related to delegation is included in Alabama Nurse Practice Act.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS RNs consider  consulting  with  their  legal  counsel  if  there  is  confusion  or  concern regarding their legal responsibilities and risks in the delegation.
texts.text: MAS RNs consider  consulting  with  their  legal  counsel  if  there  is  confusion  or  concern regarding their legal responsibilities and risks in the delegation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Education
texts.text: Education

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation is a skill that must be taught and practiced for nurses to be proficient in using it in the delivery of nursing care. It is a process that involves professional development and the application of critical thinking, and it improves with education and experience.
texts.text: Delegation is a skill that must be taught and practiced for nurses to be proficient in using it in the delivery of nursing care. It is a process that involves professional development and the application of critical thinking, and it improves with education and experience.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation skills are learned and developed over time. The MAS RN assumes personal accountability for developing critical thinking skills. This personal accountability is consistent with ANA's foundational documents, the Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements (2001), Nursing's Social Policy Statement, Second Edition (2003), and the Nursing Scope and Standards of Practice (2003).
texts.text: Delegation skills are learned and developed over time. The MAS RN assumes personal accountability for developing critical thinking skills. This personal accountability is consistent with ANA's foundational documents, the Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements (2001), Nursing's Social Policy Statement, Second Edition (2003), and the Nursing Scope and Standards of Practice (2003).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Eight steps for self-appraisal of critical thinking skills to support accountability include the following:
texts.text: Eight steps for self-appraisal of critical thinking skills to support accountability include the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Reflect on the way in which you think and review those steps you most often miss.
texts.text: Reflect on the way in which you think and review those steps you most often miss.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Learn from your mistakes and the mistakes of others.
texts.text: Learn from your mistakes and the mistakes of others.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Recognize personal indicators that warn you that your thinking ability may be less than optimal, such as illness, short staffing, or stress at home that reduces focus on work issues.
texts.text: Recognize personal indicators that warn you that your thinking ability may be less than optimal, such as illness, short staffing, or stress at home that reduces focus on work issues.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Participate in or lead discussions of clinical scenarios.
texts.text: Participate in or lead discussions of clinical scenarios.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Participate in a mentorship or preceptor program, either as a participant or as a mentor or preceptor.
texts.text: Participate in a mentorship or preceptor program, either as a participant or as a mentor or preceptor.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Develop an individual educational plan based on what you have learned or identified as strengths and educational needs from reflection and feedback.
texts.text: Develop an individual educational plan based on what you have learned or identified as strengths and educational needs from reflection and feedback.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. Trust your intuition or the immediate apprehension that something is wrong without the benefit of conscious reasoning.
texts.text: Trust your intuition or the immediate apprehension that something is wrong without the benefit of conscious reasoning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. Use a model for creative thinking and problem-solving to habituate step-by-step critical processes.
texts.text: Use a model for creative thinking and problem-solving to habituate step-by-step critical processes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS Nurses are educated and mentored on how to delegate and supervise others effectively, including giving and receiving feedback.
texts.text: MAS Nurses are educated and mentored on how to delegate and supervise others effectively, including giving and receiving feedback.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Nurse educators are encouraged to provide programs that include the principles for delegation and address areas for needed improvement.
texts.text: Nurse educators are encouraged to provide programs that include the principles for delegation and address areas for needed improvement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The guidelines related to delegation include the rules of delegation, the law, the profession's position on delegation, communication issues related to the MAS RN and the person, as well as the significant professional, legal, and ethical responsibilities and liabilities inherent in roles in which delegation is significant.
texts.text: The guidelines related to delegation include the rules of delegation, the law, the profession's position on delegation, communication issues related to the MAS RN and the person, as well as the significant professional, legal, and ethical responsibilities and liabilities inherent in roles in which delegation is significant.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Care Provisions
texts.text: Care Provisions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Elements essential for effective delegation include the following:
texts.text: Elements essential for effective delegation include the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Emphasis on professional nursing practice.
texts.text: Emphasis on professional nursing practice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Definition of delegation based on the Nurse Practice Act and regulations.
texts.text: Definition of delegation based on the Nurse Practice Act and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Review of specific sections of the law and regulations regarding delegation and identification of disciplinary actions related to inappropriate delegation.
texts.text: Review of specific sections of the law and regulations regarding delegation and identification of disciplinary actions related to inappropriate delegation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Emphasis on tasks/functions that cannot be delegated.
texts.text: Emphasis on tasks/functions that cannot be delegated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Focus on MAS RN judgment for task analysis and decision to delegate.
texts.text: Focus on MAS RN judgment for task analysis and decision to delegate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Determination of the degree of supervision required for delegation.
texts.text: Determination of the degree of supervision required for delegation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. Identification of guidelines for lowering risk related to delegation.
texts.text: Identification of guidelines for lowering risk related to delegation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. Development of feedback mechanisms to ensure that the task is completed and to receive updated data to evaluate the outcome.
texts.text: Development of feedback mechanisms to ensure that the task is completed and to receive updated data to evaluate the outcome.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Consistent with the Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements (ANA, 2001 ), the nurse must not engage in practices prohibited by law or delegated to others, activities prohibited by practice acts of other health care personnel, or other laws. MAS RNs determine the scope of their practice by considering their education, knowledge, competence, and extent of experience. The MAS RN is frequently called upon to carry out components of care delegated by other health care professionals as part of the person's treatment regime. When accepting a delegated assignment from another healthcare professional, if the MAS RN concludes that he/she is inadequately prepared to carry out a specific function, the MAS RN has the responsibility to refuse that work and to seek alternative sources for care based on concern for the person's welfare. In that refusal, both the person and the MAS RN are protected, because the MAS RN is accountable for the continuous care of persons in health care settings. The MAS RN does not accept delegation of interdependent functions if they are so extensive as to prevent the MAS RN from fulfilling the responsibility to provide appropriate nursing care to persons (ANA 1995).
texts.text: Consistent with the Code of Ethics for Nurses with Interpretive Statements (ANA, 2001 ), the nurse must not engage in practices prohibited by law or delegated to others, activities prohibited by practice acts of other health care personnel, or other laws. MAS RNs determine the scope of their practice by considering their education, knowledge, competence, and extent of experience. The MAS RN is frequently called upon to carry out components of care delegated by other health care professionals as part of the person's treatment regime. When accepting a delegated assignment from another healthcare professional, if the MAS RN concludes that he/she is inadequately prepared to carry out a specific function, the MAS RN has the responsibility to refuse that work and to seek alternative sources for care based on concern for the person's welfare. In that refusal, both the person and the MAS RN are protected, because the MAS RN is accountable for the continuous care of persons in health care settings. The MAS RN does not accept delegation of interdependent functions if they are so extensive as to prevent the MAS RN from fulfilling the responsibility to provide appropriate nursing care to persons (ANA 1995).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Steps of the Delegation Process
texts.text: Steps of the Delegation Process

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Assess and plan the delegation, based on the person's needs and available resources.
texts.text: Assess and plan the delegation, based on the person's needs and available resources.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Communicate directions to the delegate including any unique personal requirements and characteristics as well as clear expectations regarding what to do, what to report, and when to ask for assistance.
texts.text: Communicate directions to the delegate including any unique personal requirements and characteristics as well as clear expectations regarding what to do, what to report, and when to ask for assistance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Surveillance and Supervision of the delegation, including the level of supervision needed for the situation and the implementation of that supervision, including follow-up to problems or a changing situation.
texts.text: Surveillance and Supervision of the delegation, including the level of supervision needed for the situation and the implementation of that supervision, including follow-up to problems or a changing situation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Evaluation and Feedback to consider the effectiveness of the delegation, including any need to adjust the plan of care.
texts.text: Evaluation and Feedback to consider the effectiveness of the delegation, including any need to adjust the plan of care.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation skills are developed over time. Nursing employers need to recognize that a newly licensed nurse is a novice who is still acquiring foundational knowledge and skills. In addition, many nurses lack the knowledge, skills, and confidence to delegate effectively, so ongoing opportunities to enforce the theory and apply the principles of delegation to essential parts of employee orientation and staff development.
texts.text: Delegation skills are developed over time. Nursing employers need to recognize that a newly licensed nurse is a novice who is still acquiring foundational knowledge and skills. In addition, many nurses lack the knowledge, skills, and confidence to delegate effectively, so ongoing opportunities to enforce the theory and apply the principles of delegation to essential parts of employee orientation and staff development.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Many nurses are reluctant to delegate. There are many contributing factors, ranging from not having had educational opportunities to lea how to work with others effectively, not knowing the skill level and abilities of nursing assistive personnel (MAC Workers), the work pace, and turnover of persons. At the same time, there has been an increase in the complexity of the nursing tasks performed by assistive personnel. With the demographic changes and increasing need for nursing services, plus the nursing shortage, nurses need the support of nursing assistive personnel.
texts.text: Many nurses are reluctant to delegate. There are many contributing factors, ranging from not having had educational opportunities to lea how to work with others effectively, not knowing the skill level and abilities of nursing assistive personnel (MAC Workers), the work pace, and turnover of persons. At the same time, there has been an increase in the complexity of the nursing tasks performed by assistive personnel. With the demographic changes and increasing need for nursing services, plus the nursing shortage, nurses need the support of nursing assistive personnel.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Reasons for the Nurse Delegation System
texts.text: Reasons for the Nurse Delegation System

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation programs occur because there are inadequate numbers of nursing professionals to administer every medication to every person in programs certified by the ADMH. The Federal Olmstead regulations required States to offer disabled individuals services in the least restrictive environment. The Nurse Delegation Program (NDP) prevents the institutionalization of persons with mental disorders. The NDP allows persons with mental disorders to receive services in small, home-like environments, with nurse extenders (MAC Workers) who assist the MAS Nurses to provide adequate care to the persons served. The NDP does not diminish the value of nurses or dilute the importance of their professional judgment. The Alabama Nurse Practice Act states:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Community Providers certified by ADMH are responsible for assuring compliance with the NDP and that there are a sufficient number of staff to provide services based on the needs of the persons served. ADMH Certified Providers are responsible for assuring that a sufficient number of MAS RN/MAS LPNs are available to supervise MAC Workers 24 hours per day, 7 days per week. It is expected that important decisions about personal nursing care or changes in a person's status are addressed by a MAS RN/MAS LPN.

texts.text: Safeguards in the NDP

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse who signs the delegation form, delegating authority to a MAC Worker has the power to certify and decertify the MAC Worker.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse who signs the delegation form, delegating authority to a MAC Worker has the power to certify and decertify the MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' The MAS RN/MAS LPN delegating the task may at any time suspend or withdraw the delegation of specific tasks to a mental health worker'
texts.text: ' The MAS RN/MAS LPN delegating the task may at any time suspend or withdraw the delegation of specific tasks to a mental health worker'

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: [ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06(8)]
texts.text: [ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06(8)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The decertified MAC Worker is not terminated from employment by the nurse but rather the agency management determines whether to continue employment. Under most circumstances, the MAS Nurse does not employ the MAC Worker but specifies that the unlicensed person can manage the delegated responsibilities. MAC Workers should not receive delegated authority because the facility lacks adequate manpower to meet the service requirements. The MAC Worker can only receive delegation authority when a MAS Nurse has determined that he/she can meet the professional standards of a MAC Worker. Any violation of the practice should be reported to the certifying Division and/or NDP Office of the ADMH.
texts.text: The decertified MAC Worker is not terminated from employment by the nurse but rather the agency management determines whether to continue employment. Under most circumstances, the MAS Nurse does not employ the MAC Worker but specifies that the unlicensed person can manage the delegated responsibilities. MAC Workers should not receive delegated authority because the facility lacks adequate manpower to meet the service requirements. The MAC Worker can only receive delegation authority when a MAS Nurse has determined that he/she can meet the professional standards of a MAC Worker. Any violation of the practice should be reported to the certifying Division and/or NDP Office of the ADMH.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A decertification decision must be carefully documented. Decertification can occur based on the occurrences of a breach in the NDP guidelines, the occurrence of Level 2 or Level 3 medication errors, or repeated minor violations that suggest the lack of professionalism and competency of the MAC Worker. A major deficiency in any of the quality domains of competency, documentation, error reporting, identification of the 7 rights of assisting with medications, professionalism, reliability, and respect, may be sufficient for temporary or permanent decertification. Intentional falsification of documentation is a very serious event and warrants consideration for decertification. Ultimately, all decertification decisions depend on the best judgment of the MAS Nurse. The Agency Administration cannot override the MAS Nurse to reinstate the MAC Worker who has been decertified by a MAS Nurse.
texts.text: A decertification decision must be carefully documented. A major deficiency in any of the quality domains of competency, documentation, error reporting, identification of the 7 rights of assisting with medications, professionalism, reliability, and respect, may be sufficient for temporary or permanent decertification. Intentional falsification of documentation is a very serious event and warrants consideration for decertification. Ultimately, all decertification decisions depend on the best judgment of the MAS Nurse. The Agency Administration cannot override the MAS Nurse to reinstate the MAC Worker who has been decertified by a MAS Nurse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Some MAS Nurses will supervise many MAC Workers. The documentation of direct supervision assures the MAC Workers have regular monitoring. Problems with a MAC Worker must be immediately reported to and addressed by the MAS Nurse who is delegating to the MAC Worker.
texts.text: Some MAS Nurses will supervise many MAC Workers. The documentation of direct supervision assures the MAC Workers have regular monitoring. Problems with a MAC Worker must be immediately reported to and addressed by the MAS Nurse who is delegating to the MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The NDP does not specify the ratio of MAS Nurses to MAC Workers because this decision is best made by the individual MAS Nurse. The MAS Nurse should not be compelled to supervise more MAC Workers than the MAS Nurse can safely manage.
texts.text: The NDP does not specify the ratio of MAS Nurses to MAC Workers because this decision is best made by the individual MAS Nurse. The MAS Nurse should not be compelled to supervise more MAC Workers than the MAS Nurse can safely manage.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definitions
texts.text: Definitions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Critical  Thinking :  A  rational  reasoning  process  that  involves  analyzing,  evaluating,  and  applying information, knowledge, skills, attitudes, and values to make a decision that affects participant care. Critical thinking is disciplined thinking that is clear, rational, open-minded, and informed by evidence. Critical thinking uses clinical and professional judgment in each part of the nursing process.
texts.text: Critical  Thinking :  A  rational  reasoning  process  that  involves  analyzing,  evaluating,  and  applying information, knowledge, skills, attitudes, and values to make a decision that affects participant care. Critical thinking is disciplined thinking that is clear, rational, open-minded, and informed by evidence. Critical thinking uses clinical and professional judgment in each part of the nursing process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation : The act of authorizing a competent individual to perform selected nursing activities supportive of registered nurses or licensed practical nurses in selected situations, while retaining accountability for the outcome, if the delegation is to an unlicensed individual. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Delegation : The act of authorizing a competent individual to perform selected nursing activities supportive of registered nurses or licensed practical nurses in selected situations, while retaining accountability for the outcome, if the delegation is to an unlicensed individual. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Accountability : Answerable or responsible for action [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Accountability : Answerable or responsible for action [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Responsibility : The charge to do something that is expected performance [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(16)]
texts.text: Responsibility : The charge to do something that is expected performance [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(16)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assignment, Licensed Nurse : The transfer of responsibility and accountability for nursing activities from one licensed nurse to another. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Assignment, Licensed Nurse : The transfer of responsibility and accountability for nursing activities from one licensed nurse to another. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assignment, Unlicensed Individual : The assignment of tasks from a licensed nurse (MAS) to unlicensed assistive  personnel  (MAC).  The  licensed  nurse  making  the  assignment  retains  accountability  for  the accurate and timely completion and outcome of the tasks. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Assignment, Unlicensed Individual : The assignment of tasks from a licensed nurse (MAS) to unlicensed assistive  personnel  (MAC).  The  licensed  nurse  making  the  assignment  retains  accountability  for  the accurate and timely completion and outcome of the tasks. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Nursing Process : The protection, promotion, and optimization of health and abilities, prevention of illness and injury, alleviation of suffering through the diagnosis and treatment of human response, and advocacy in the care of individuals, families, communities, and populations. (American Nurses Association).  The nursing  process  is  a  professional,  systemic  approach  that  consists  of  assessing,  diagnosing,  planning, implementing, and evaluating the care provided.
texts.text: Nursing Process : The protection, promotion, and optimization of health and abilities, prevention of illness and injury, alleviation of suffering through the diagnosis and treatment of human response, and advocacy in the care of individuals, families, communities, and populations. (American Nurses Association).  The nursing  process  is  a  professional,  systemic  approach  that  consists  of  assessing,  diagnosing,  planning, implementing, and evaluating the care provided.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assessment,  Comprehensive :  The  systematic  collection  and  analysis  of  data,  including  the  physical, psychological, social, cultural, and spiritual aspects of the patient by the registered nurse for the purpose of judging  a  patient's  health  and  illness  status  and  actual  or  potential  health  needs.  The  comprehensive assessment includes patient history, physical examination, analysis of the data collected, and development, implementation, and evaluation of the patient's plan of care.  [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Assessment,  Comprehensive :  The  systematic  collection  and  analysis  of  data,  including  the  physical, psychological, social, cultural, and spiritual aspects of the patient by the registered nurse for the purpose of judging  a  patient's  health  and  illness  status  and  actual  or  potential  health  needs.  The  comprehensive assessment includes patient history, physical examination, analysis of the data collected, and development, implementation, and evaluation of the patient's plan of care.  [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Assessment, Focused : An appraisal of a patient's status and specific complaint through observation and collection of objective and subjective data by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse. Focused assessment may contribute to a comprehensive assessment performed by the registered nurse and involves the identification of normal and abnormal findings, and anticipation and recognition of changes or potential changes in the patient's health status. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Assessment, Focused : An appraisal of a patient's status and specific complaint through observation and collection of objective and subjective data by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse. Focused assessment may contribute to a comprehensive assessment performed by the registered nurse and involves the identification of normal and abnormal findings, and anticipation and recognition of changes or potential changes in the patient's health status. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Status Change : A medical status change is a clinical event that signals a worsening in a patient's condition. Any medical issue that requires hospitalization, a new diagnosis ( medical or psychiatric), fractures, new medical equipment, or an increased level of care (1:1).
texts.text: Status Change : A medical status change is a clinical event that signals a worsening in a patient's condition. Any medical issue that requires hospitalization, a new diagnosis ( medical or psychiatric), fractures, new medical equipment, or an increased level of care (1:1).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Supervision, Direct : Responsible licensed nurse is physically present in the facility and readily accessible to designate or prescribe a course of action or to give procedural guidance, direction, and periodic evaluation. Direct supervision by a registered nurse is required for new graduates practicing on a temporary permit. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Supervision, Direct : Responsible licensed nurse is physically present in the facility and readily accessible to designate or prescribe a course of action or to give procedural guidance, direction, and periodic evaluation. Direct supervision by a registered nurse is required for new graduates practicing on a temporary permit. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Supervision,  Indirect :  Responsible  licensed  nurse  is  available  for  periodic  inspection  and  evaluation through physical presence, and electronic or telephonic communication for direction, consultation, and collaboration. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Supervision,  Indirect :  Responsible  licensed  nurse  is  available  for  periodic  inspection  and  evaluation through physical presence, and electronic or telephonic communication for direction, consultation, and collaboration. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication Administration : Removal of an individual dose of medication, from a previously dispensed, properly labeled container, verifying it with the prescriber's orders. Giving the correct dose, to the correct person, at the correct time, the correct way, observing that the person has taken the medication, and recording appropriately.
texts.text: Medication Administration : Removal of an individual dose of medication, from a previously dispensed, properly labeled container, verifying it with the prescriber's orders. Giving the correct dose, to the correct person, at the correct time, the correct way, observing that the person has taken the medication, and recording appropriately.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication Assistant Certified Worker (MAC) : Mental health worker who successfully completed the approved curriculum for assistance with medications in community residential settings. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2.07(2)]
texts.text: Medication Assistant Certified Worker (MAC) : Mental health worker who successfully completed the approved curriculum for assistance with medications in community residential settings. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2.07(2)]

texts.orig: Direct Care Workers who participate with the delegation in ADMH/NDP community programs.
texts.text: Direct Care Workers who participate with the delegation in ADMH/NDP community programs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication  Assistant  Supervisor  (MAS) :  A  licensed  nurse  who  supervises  Medication  Assistant, Certified (MAC). [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.07(l)]
texts.text: Medication  Assistant  Supervisor  (MAS) :  A  licensed  nurse  who  supervises  Medication  Assistant, Certified (MAC). [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.07(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Nurse Delegation Program (NDP) : An exception to the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, this allows properly trained nurses, employed by agencies certified by ADMH to delegate specific, limited tasks to specific, trained unlicensed personnel (MAC workers).
texts.text: Nurse Delegation Program (NDP) : An exception to the Alabama Nurse Practice Act, this allows properly trained nurses, employed by agencies certified by ADMH to delegate specific, limited tasks to specific, trained unlicensed personnel (MAC workers).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Alabama Board of Nursing (ABN) : A State government agency that is responsible for the regulation of the nursing practice. ABN directs and controls the administration of medications.
texts.text: Alabama Board of Nursing (ABN) : A State government agency that is responsible for the regulation of the nursing practice. ABN directs and controls the administration of medications.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Encumbered  License :  Alabama  Board  of  Nursing  defines  an  encumbered  license  as  'The  term 'encumbered' refers to probation, suspension, or revocation of license. A nurse with an encumbered license cannot be a MAS Nurse .  (An  existing  MAS  nurse  that  becomes  'encumbered'  after  receiving  MAS certificate must notify the Coordinator of Nurse Delegation).
texts.text: Encumbered  License :  Alabama  Board  of  Nursing  defines  an  encumbered  license  as  'The  term 'encumbered' refers to probation, suspension, or revocation of license. A nurse with an encumbered license cannot be a MAS Nurse .  (An  existing  MAS  nurse  that  becomes  'encumbered'  after  receiving  MAS certificate must notify the Coordinator of Nurse Delegation).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Professional Nurse :  A registered nurse (MAS RN); the performance, for compensation, of any act in the care and counseling of persons or in the promotion and maintenance of health and prevention of illness and injury based upon the nursing process.  (Nurse Practice Act, Article 1)
texts.text: Professional Nurse :  A registered nurse (MAS RN); the performance, for compensation, of any act in the care and counseling of persons or in the promotion and maintenance of health and prevention of illness and injury based upon the nursing process.  (Nurse Practice Act, Article 1)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Practical  Nurse :  A  licensed  practical  nurse  (MAS  LPN);  the  performance,  for  compensation,  of  acts designed to promote and maintain health, prevent illness and injury and provide care utilizing standardized procedures and the nursing process, under the direction of a licensed professional nurse or a licensed or otherwise legally authorized physician or dentist. (Nurse Practice Act, Article 1)
texts.text: Practical  Nurse :  A  licensed  practical  nurse  (MAS  LPN);  the  performance,  for  compensation,  of  acts designed to promote and maintain health, prevent illness and injury and provide care utilizing standardized procedures and the nursing process, under the direction of a licensed professional nurse or a licensed or otherwise legally authorized physician or dentist. (Nurse Practice Act, Article 1)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Alabama Board of Pharmacy (ABP) : A State government agency that is responsible for regulating the practice of pharmacy.  The agency that directs and controls the provision and storage of medications.
texts.text: Alabama Board of Pharmacy (ABP) : A State government agency that is responsible for regulating the practice of pharmacy.  The agency that directs and controls the provision and storage of medications.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication Administration Record (MAR) : Medical-legal document where all medications administered are recorded is part of the person's medical record and cannot be thrown away.
texts.text: Medication Administration Record (MAR) : Medical-legal document where all medications administered are recorded is part of the person's medical record and cannot be thrown away.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: OTC :  over  the  counter;  medications  that  can  be  bought  in  a  store  (For  people  served  in  ADMH/NDP certified programs, a prescription is required)
texts.text: OTC :  over  the  counter;  medications  that  can  be  bought  in  a  store  (For  people  served  in  ADMH/NDP certified programs, a prescription is required)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Alabama Department of Mental Health (ADMH) :  State agency that has the authority to certify and reimburse agencies for services provided to persons with mental disorders.
texts.text: Alabama Department of Mental Health (ADMH) :  State agency that has the authority to certify and reimburse agencies for services provided to persons with mental disorders.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: HIPAA :    Health  Insurance  Portability  and  Accountability  Act.    Federal  law  protects  the  privacy  of individuals and limits the distribution of confidential health information.
texts.text: HIPAA :    Health  Insurance  Portability  and  Accountability  Act.    Federal  law  protects  the  privacy  of individuals and limits the distribution of confidential health information.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Legally  Authorized  Prescriber :  Healthcare  professional  who  is  authorized  by  law  to  prescribe medications or other treatment modalities. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Legally  Authorized  Prescriber :  Healthcare  professional  who  is  authorized  by  law  to  prescribe medications or other treatment modalities. [ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MAC I : A computer E-learning course that covers basic information regarding assisting with medications in mental health treatment settings.  MAC I consists of six individual sections that must be completed with 90% accuracy on all modules.  The completion of MAC I allows an individual employed with any agency certified by ADMH to advance to the MAC II course.
texts.text: MAC I : A computer E-learning course that covers basic information regarding assisting with medications in mental health treatment settings.  MAC I consists of six individual sections that must be completed with 90% accuracy on all modules.  The completion of MAC I allows an individual employed with any agency certified by ADMH to advance to the MAC II course.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MAC II : A minimum of eight hours of hands-on training provided by a MAS nurse (MAS RN or MAS LPN) to ensure a person that has successfully completed the six MAC I modules is competent to perform basic skills/tasks and assume delegation responsibilities.  A MAS nurse must verify competency prior to delegating any task to an unlicensed person.
texts.text: MAC II : A minimum of eight hours of hands-on training provided by a MAS nurse (MAS RN or MAS LPN) to ensure a person that has successfully completed the six MAC I modules is competent to perform basic skills/tasks and assume delegation responsibilities.  A MAS nurse must verify competency prior to delegating any task to an unlicensed person.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Standard  Precautions :  Recommendations  issued  by  the  Centers  for  Disease  Control  and  Prevention (CDC) to minimize the risk of transmission of pathogens. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]
texts.text: Standard  Precautions :  Recommendations  issued  by  the  Centers  for  Disease  Control  and  Prevention (CDC) to minimize the risk of transmission of pathogens. [ABN Regulation 61 0-X-2-.06(l)]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Decertify :  Remove  a  certificate  or  certification  from  (someone  or  something),  typically  for  failure  to comply with a regulating authority's rules or standards. (May apply to MAS Nurse or MAC worker)
texts.text: Decertify :  Remove  a  certificate  or  certification  from  (someone  or  something),  typically  for  failure  to comply with a regulating authority's rules or standards. (May apply to MAS Nurse or MAC worker)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Suspend : temporary halt of delegation (all or part) until an action can be completed (example: training)
texts.text: Suspend : temporary halt of delegation (all or part) until an action can be completed (example: training)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Advisory Committee : 10 Experienced Nurse members from ID/DD/MI/SA and the Coordinator of NDP committee  meets  at  least  quarterly  and  discuss  potential  changes  in  the  Nurse  Delegating  Programs processes
texts.text: Advisory Committee : 10 Experienced Nurse members from ID/DD/MI/SA and the Coordinator of NDP committee  meets  at  least  quarterly  and  discuss  potential  changes  in  the  Nurse  Delegating  Programs processes

texts.orig: NOTES TO MAS NURSE
texts.text: NOTES TO MAS NURSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When transcribing orders, be sure you do not use abbreviations you have not taught the MAC Worker. The best practice is to spell words out instead of using abbreviations on the MAR.
texts.text: When transcribing orders, be sure you do not use abbreviations you have not taught the MAC Worker. The best practice is to spell words out instead of using abbreviations on the MAR.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NOTES TO MAS NURSE
texts.text: NOTES TO MAS NURSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Nurse Delegation Program is a NURSE DRIVEN program. The unlicensed workers, called MAC Workers, are extenders, not replacements, of the nurse. All skilled tasks must be completed by licensed nurses and documented accordingly.
texts.text: The Nurse Delegation Program is a NURSE DRIVEN program. The unlicensed workers, called MAC Workers, are extenders, not replacements, of the nurse. All skilled tasks must be completed by licensed nurses and documented accordingly.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Nurse Delegation Program
texts.text: The Nurse Delegation Program

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · This program is the exception to the Nurse Practice Act that allows properly trained nurses, employed by agencies certified by ADMH to delegate selected nursing tasks to trained unlicensed personnel.
texts.text: This program is the exception to the Nurse Practice Act that allows properly trained nurses, employed by agencies certified by ADMH to delegate selected nursing tasks to trained unlicensed personnel.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The NDP provides information to the licensed and unlicensed workforce in mental health community programs regarding mental and physical disorders, as well as preventive healthcare.
texts.text: The NDP provides information to the licensed and unlicensed workforce in mental health community programs regarding mental and physical disorders, as well as preventive healthcare.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The NDP is utilized by people with mental disorders living and working in the community.
texts.text: The NDP is utilized by people with mental disorders living and working in the community.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The NDP focuses on safety by assuring that people served who are unable to self-medicate in community programs receive their medications safely and effectively.
texts.text: The NDP focuses on safety by assuring that people served who are unable to self-medicate in community programs receive their medications safely and effectively.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The NDP focuses on safety by creating a system to maximize accuracy and reduce the likelihood of medication administration errors.
texts.text: The NDP focuses on safety by creating a system to maximize accuracy and reduce the likelihood of medication administration errors.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · This manual is designed to assist the medication administration supervising (MAS) nurse in understanding the responsibility of delegation, training, and verifying competency of all nursing tasks delegated to unlicensed personnel.
texts.text: This manual is designed to assist the medication administration supervising (MAS) nurse in understanding the responsibility of delegation, training, and verifying competency of all nursing tasks delegated to unlicensed personnel.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · This manual complements the MAC I computer training and provides guidance on the following:
texts.text: This manual complements the MAC I computer training and provides guidance on the following:

texts.orig: o documentation

texts.text: Organizational Responsibilities
