texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Goals of the NDP are as follows:
texts.text: Goals of the NDP are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.    Provide safe and accurate assistance with medication administration.
texts.text: Provide safe and accurate assistance with medication administration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Provide  safe  and  effective  nursing  care  to  persons  served  in  ADMH Community Programs.
texts.text: Provide  safe  and  effective  nursing  care  to  persons  served  in  ADMH Community Programs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Objectives of the MAC Training Program are as follows:
texts.text: Objectives of the MAC Training Program are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Teach the rights and responsibilities of the MAC Worker.
texts.text: Teach the rights and responsibilities of the MAC Worker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Teach the proper procedures for assisting with medication and other delegated nursing tasks.
texts.text: Teach the proper procedures for assisting with medication and other delegated nursing tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Teach the MAS - MAC Connection.
texts.text: Teach the MAS - MAC Connection.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Teach how to recognize and report medication errors, adverse reactions, and any other problems to the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Teach how to recognize and report medication errors, adverse reactions, and any other problems to the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The two parts of the MAC Training Program are as follows:
texts.text: The two parts of the MAC Training Program are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. MAC I- Training via computer e-learning system (didactic training).
texts.text: MAC I- Training via computer e-learning system (didactic training).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. MAC II - Training must be completed by a MAS RN or MAS LPN licensed in Alabama with a current certificate. (hands-on practicum).
texts.text: MAC II - Training must be completed by a MAS RN or MAS LPN licensed in Alabama with a current certificate. (hands-on practicum).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. A maximum of 20 students may be in MAC II class per MAS Nurse.
texts.text: A maximum of 20 students may be in MAC II class per MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAC Certification requires the following:
texts.text: MAC Certification requires the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Successful completion of MAC I with a score of 90% or above for each of the 6 modules.
texts.text: Successful completion of MAC I with a score of 90% or above for each of the 6 modules.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Completion of a minimum of 8 hours of MAC II hands-on training with the MAS nurse, and satisfactory performance of all tasks to be delegated utilizing the Skills Check List.
texts.text: Completion of a minimum of 8 hours of MAC II hands-on training with the MAS nurse, and satisfactory performance of all tasks to be delegated utilizing the Skills Check List.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The MAS Nurse makes the final decision to delegate based on performance during MAC II.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse makes the final decision to delegate based on performance during MAC II.

texts.orig: · Unencumbered license. If the license becomes encumbered after MAS approval is received, the nurse must notify the Coordinator of Nurse Delegation.

texts.orig: · Successful completion of the ABN-approved training to become a MAS Nurse in ADMH Community Programs.
texts.text: Successful completion of the ABN-approved training to become a MAS Nurse in ADMH Community Programs.

texts.orig: · Maintain current MAS certificate (UPDATE/REVA LI DATI O N       is required every two years).
texts.text: Maintain current MAS certificate (UPDATE/REVA LI DATI O N       is required every two years).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Responsible and accountable for the scope of education, demonstrated competence, and nursing experience to work with persons with mental disorders. [ABN regulation 610-X-6-.03(4)]
texts.text: Responsible and accountable for the scope of education, demonstrated competence, and nursing experience to work with persons with mental disorders. [ABN regulation 610-X-6-.03(4)]

texts.text: HS Diploma/GED/College Transcript.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful completion of ABN-approved 6 courses of MAC 1 as evidenced by a printed certificate of completion.
texts.text: Successful completion of ABN-approved 6 courses of MAC 1 as evidenced by a printed certificate of completion.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful completion of MAC II as evidenced by competency checklist completed by MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Successful completion of MAC II as evidenced by competency checklist completed by MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Signature on delegation form with the signature of delegating MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Signature on delegation form with the signature of delegating MAS Nurse.

texts.orig: · Maintain current MAC Certificate (MAC  UPDATE/RECERTIFICATION required every two years).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Ability to distinguish between 'skilled' and 'unskilled' tasks. ('Skilled' task MUST be performed by the licensed nurse only).
texts.text: Ability to distinguish between 'skilled' and 'unskilled' tasks. ('Skilled' task MUST be performed by the licensed nurse only).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Components of the NDP
texts.text: Components of the NDP

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1. Organizational Responsibilities
texts.text: 1. Organizational Responsibilities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible and accountable for providing sufficient resources including the appropriate staff mix, needed equipment, and supplies.
texts.text: The agency is responsible and accountable for providing sufficient resources including the appropriate staff mix, needed equipment, and supplies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency administration should have depth and flexibility in human resources (licensed nurses) to assure that loss of a licensed professional (nurse) due to illness, accidents, or administrative changes is covered by other licensed professionals (nurses) within the organization or geographical area.
texts.text: The agency administration should have depth and flexibility in human resources (licensed nurses) to assure that loss of a licensed professional (nurse) due to illness, accidents, or administrative changes is covered by other licensed professionals (nurses) within the organization or geographical area.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The local emergency room/Urgent Care CAN NOT be used as a backup for licensed nurses unless:
texts.text: The local emergency room/Urgent Care CAN NOT be used as a backup for licensed nurses unless:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o there is a structured, written agreement.
texts.text: o there is a structured, written agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o the nurse is familiar with the agency's operations.
texts.text: o the nurse is familiar with the agency's operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o the nurse is MAS trained.
texts.text: o the nurse is MAS trained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for the development and implementation of NDP-related policies and procedures approved by the agency's board of directors.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for the development and implementation of NDP-related policies and procedures approved by the agency's board of directors.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for a position description outlining the responsibilities of the MAS nurse.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for a position description outlining the responsibilities of the MAS nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for position descriptions that include the requirement to assist with medication administration.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for position descriptions that include the requirement to assist with medication administration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is required to assure each MAC Candidate has a high school diploma or GED, as evidenced by documentation in the personnel record.
texts.text: The agency is required to assure each MAC Candidate has a high school diploma or GED, as evidenced by documentation in the personnel record.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for assure the successful completion of ABNapproved MAC I (all 6 modules) training.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for assure the successful completion of ABNapproved MAC I (all 6 modules) training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for assuring all continuing education requirements are met for MAC Workers and MAS Nurses.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for assuring all continuing education requirements are met for MAC Workers and MAS Nurses.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for assuring documentation of competencies for all personnel is maintained.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for assuring documentation of competencies for all personnel is maintained.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for creating an environment conducive to teamwork, collaboration, and person-centered care.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for creating an environment conducive to teamwork, collaboration, and person-centered care.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The agency is responsible for assuring compliance with all Local, State, and Federal laws.
texts.text: The agency is responsible for assuring compliance with all Local, State, and Federal laws.

texts.orig: 2. Education and Training
texts.text: 2. Education and Training

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall be familiar with key psychiatric, medical, and behavioral problems encountered in the mental health community treatment continuum.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall be familiar with key psychiatric, medical, and behavioral problems encountered in the mental health community treatment continuum.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall be familiar with issues that impact medication compliance. This must be stressed during MAC II training.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall be familiar with issues that impact medication compliance. This must be stressed during MAC II training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall be knowledgeable about the agency's emergency and seizure management plan and shall review these plans during the MAC II training.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall be knowledgeable about the agency's emergency and seizure management plan and shall review these plans during the MAC II training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Any additional training for specialized medications (i.e., Narcan, Diastat, Epipen) shall be documented on the skills checklist.
texts.text: o Any additional training for specialized medications (i.e., Narcan, Diastat, Epipen) shall be documented on the skills checklist.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall emphasize the importance of observation in detecting potentially dangerous problems and correct reporting procedures. (Encourage the use of the observation checklist)
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall emphasize the importance of observation in detecting potentially dangerous problems and correct reporting procedures. (Encourage the use of the observation checklist)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall stress the importance of the MAS - MAC Connection. (CALL THE MAS NURSES FOR ANY PROBLEMS, ANY QUESTIONS, OR ANY TIME THE MAC WORKER IS NOT SURE.)
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall stress the importance of the MAS - MAC Connection. (CALL THE MAS NURSES FOR ANY PROBLEMS, ANY QUESTIONS, OR ANY TIME THE MAC WORKER IS NOT SURE.)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse may include additional, supplemental information that does not contradict or conflict with course materials.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse may include additional, supplemental information that does not contradict or conflict with course materials.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall explain the importance of and the responsibility associated with assisting with medication administration.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall explain the importance of and the responsibility associated with assisting with medication administration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall emphasize the rights and humanity of the people served.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall emphasize the rights and humanity of the people served.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse is encouraged to use real situations as clinical examples for the MAC Worker who will be providing care for the people we serve. Some medications or medical problems may not exist in your population; in this case, the MAS Nurse is encouraged to use clinical examples to highlight pertinent issues.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse is encouraged to use real situations as clinical examples for the MAC Worker who will be providing care for the people we serve. Some medications or medical problems may not exist in your population; in this case, the MAS Nurse is encouraged to use clinical examples to highlight pertinent issues.

texts.orig: 4. Compliance
texts.text: 4. Compliance

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Compliance with NDP will be assessed by ADMH Certification Surveyors during the agency's certification site visit and routine monitoring by ADMH staff .
texts.text: Compliance with NDP will be assessed by ADMH Certification Surveyors during the agency's certification site visit and routine monitoring by ADMH staff .

texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall be accessible to surveyors.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall be accessible to surveyors.

texts.text: Noncompliance with NDP may result in the decertification of the agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: SECTION 5 Alabama Law
texts.text: SECTION 5 Alabama Law

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NOTES TO MAS NURSE
texts.text: NOTES TO MAS NURSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Every nurse licensed in Alabama is required to practice in compliance with the Nurse Practice Act regardless of the location of your nursing practice (hospital, homecare, office, community). The second most common reason nurses are sanctioned by the ABN is non-compliance with the Nurse Practice Act. MAS nurses are strongly encouraged to read and review the Nurse Practice Act at least annually and as needed.
texts.text: Every nurse licensed in Alabama is required to practice in compliance with the Nurse Practice Act regardless of the location of your nursing practice (hospital, homecare, office, community). The second most common reason nurses are sanctioned by the ABN is non-compliance with the Nurse Practice Act. MAS nurses are strongly encouraged to read and review the Nurse Practice Act at least annually and as needed.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IF YOU WOULD NOT DO IT IN THE HOSPITAL; DO NOT DO IT IN THE COMMUNITY.
texts.text: IF YOU WOULD NOT DO IT IN THE HOSPITAL; DO NOT DO IT IN THE COMMUNITY.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: IF YOU, DID IT IN THE HOSPITAL; YOU NEED TO DO IT IN THE COMMUNITY.
texts.text: IF YOU, DID IT IN THE HOSPITAL; YOU NEED TO DO IT IN THE COMMUNITY.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: UNDERSTANDING ALABAMA LAW
texts.text: UNDERSTANDING ALABAMA LAW

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The Nurse Delegation Program allows a non-licensed direct care worker in ADMH-certified Community Mental Health Programs to assist a MAS-trained nurse with medication administration.
texts.text: The Nurse Delegation Program allows a non-licensed direct care worker in ADMH-certified Community Mental Health Programs to assist a MAS-trained nurse with medication administration.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Alabama law limits the possession and distribution of medications to anyone other than the person prescribed the medications.
texts.text: Alabama law limits the possession and distribution of medications to anyone other than the person prescribed the medications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Family members may administer medications to children or adults who are direct blood relatives. Administration of medications by family members in ADMH-certified programs is not encouraged due to the increase in liability; however, the agency's board-approved policies and procedures should be followed as it relates to family members administering medications in ADMH-certified programs.
texts.text: Family members may administer medications to children or adults who are direct blood relatives. Administration of medications by family members in ADMH-certified programs is not encouraged due to the increase in liability; however, the agency's board-approved policies and procedures should be followed as it relates to family members administering medications in ADMH-certified programs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Persons unrelated and non-licensed are not allowed to give medicines to other individuals as part of their job function in the State of Alabama.
texts.text: Persons unrelated and non-licensed are not allowed to give medicines to other individuals as part of their job function in the State of Alabama.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Alabama law requires that a registered nurse (MAS RN) directs the care of the licensed practical nurse (MAS LPN). The MAS RN directs the care of the MAC Worker.
texts.text: Alabama law requires that a registered nurse (MAS RN) directs the care of the licensed practical nurse (MAS LPN). The MAS RN directs the care of the MAC Worker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN and/or MAS LPN may train and supervise a MAC Worker.
texts.text: The MAS RN and/or MAS LPN may train and supervise a MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Medication Assistant Certified (MAC) Worker serves as an assistant to our licensed nursing professionals.
texts.text: The Medication Assistant Certified (MAC) Worker serves as an assistant to our licensed nursing professionals.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: One of the MAC worker's primary responsibilities is to communicate with a MAS Nurse and give accurate information about the person's status.
texts.text: One of the MAC worker's primary responsibilities is to communicate with a MAS Nurse and give accurate information about the person's status.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The regulation that forms the foundation for the Nurse Delegation Program is found in the Alabama Board of Nursing Administrative Code, Regulation 610-X-7-.06
texts.text: The regulation that forms the foundation for the Nurse Delegation Program is found in the Alabama Board of Nursing Administrative Code, Regulation 610-X-7-.06

texts.label: text
texts.orig: According to Regulation 610-X-7-.06 Alabama Department of Mental Health Residential Community Programs,
texts.text: According to Regulation 610-X-7-.06 Alabama Department of Mental Health Residential Community Programs,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse who provides care in residential community mental health programs certified by the Alabama Department of Mental Health is accountable and responsible for the nursing care delivered to patients in those settings.
texts.text: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse who provides care in residential community mental health programs certified by the Alabama Department of Mental Health is accountable and responsible for the nursing care delivered to patients in those settings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Registered nurses or licensed practical nurses who provide nursing care in the residential community mental health setting, and the community extensions including day habilitation programs may delegate specific limited tasks to designated unlicensed assistive personnel.
texts.text: o Registered nurses or licensed practical nurses who provide nursing care in the residential community mental health setting, and the community extensions including day habilitation programs may delegate specific limited tasks to designated unlicensed assistive personnel.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The Registered Nurse is responsible and accountable for the completion of a comprehensive assessment and evaluation of the patient's nursing care needs.
texts.text: o The Registered Nurse is responsible and accountable for the completion of a comprehensive assessment and evaluation of the patient's nursing care needs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o A The MAS LPN may initiate and document data elements of the comprehensive assessment. The outcome of the comprehensive assessment determines the tasks that may be safely performed by unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings.
texts.text: o A The MAS LPN may initiate and document data elements of the comprehensive assessment. The outcome of the comprehensive assessment determines the tasks that may be safely performed by unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The specific delegated tasks shall not require the exercise of independent nursing judgment or intervention. Specific tasks that require independent nursing judgment or intervention that shall not be delegated include, but are not limited to, the following:
texts.text: o The specific delegated tasks shall not require the exercise of independent nursing judgment or intervention. Specific tasks that require independent nursing judgment or intervention that shall not be delegated include, but are not limited to, the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Catheterization, clean or sterile.
texts.text: Catheterization, clean or sterile.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Administration of injectable medications, except for pre-measured emergency injectable medication or anaphylaxis such as the Epi-pen.
texts.text: Administration of injectable medications, except for pre-measured emergency injectable medication or anaphylaxis such as the Epi-pen.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Calculation of medication dosages other than measuring a prescribed amount of liquid medication or breaking a scored tablet.
texts.text: Calculation of medication dosages other than measuring a prescribed amount of liquid medication or breaking a scored tablet.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Tracheotomy care, including suctioning.
texts.text: Tracheotomy care, including suctioning.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Gastric tube insertion, replacement, or feedings.
texts.text: Gastric tube insertion, replacement, or feedings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Invasive procedures or techniques.
texts.text: Invasive procedures or techniques.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Sterile procedures.
texts.text: Sterile procedures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Ventilator care.
texts.text: Ventilator care.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Receipt of verbal or telephone orders from a licensed prescriber.
texts.text: Receipt of verbal or telephone orders from a licensed prescriber.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The task of assisting with the delivery of prescribed eye, ear, nose oral, topical, inhalant, rectal, or vaginal medications may only be delegated to a mental health worker by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse only when the following conditions are met:
texts.text: The task of assisting with the delivery of prescribed eye, ear, nose oral, topical, inhalant, rectal, or vaginal medications may only be delegated to a mental health worker by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse only when the following conditions are met:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse identifies the appropriate individual(s) to assist in providing prescribed medications.
texts.text: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse identifies the appropriate individual(s) to assist in providing prescribed medications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The mental health worker selected by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall complete six (6) courses of MAC I Training via E-learning computer modules with a minimum score of 90% on all testing.  Successful completion of MAC I Training shall be followed by the successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II Training conducted by a MAS Trained RN/LPN. (The potential MAC Worker has 5 opportunities to pass each module).
texts.text: o The mental health worker selected by the registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall complete six (6) courses of MAC I Training via E-learning computer modules with a minimum score of 90% on all testing.  Successful completion of MAC I Training shall be followed by the successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II Training conducted by a MAS Trained RN/LPN. (The potential MAC Worker has 5 opportunities to pass each module).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall provide and document annual evaluation and monitoring of the unlicensed individual performing the delegated tasks. The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall assess and document annually at a minimum the following:
texts.text: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall provide and document annual evaluation and monitoring of the unlicensed individual performing the delegated tasks. The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse shall assess and document annually at a minimum the following:

texts.orig: ▪ Documentation

texts.orig: ▪ Professionalism

texts.text: Respect

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse delegating the task may, at any time, suspend or withdraw the delegation of specific tasks to mental health worker(s).
texts.text: o The registered nurse or licensed practical nurse delegating the task may, at any time, suspend or withdraw the delegation of specific tasks to mental health worker(s).

texts.orig: o The Commissioner of the Alabama Department of Mental Health shall submit a report(s) to the Alabama Board of Nursing in a format specified by the Board upon request to include but not limited to:

texts.text: NOTES TO MAS NURSE

texts.text: Review during MAC II Training

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: PEOPLE WHO MAKE UP THE  TREATMENT TEAM
texts.text: PEOPLE WHO MAKE UP THE  TREATMENT TEAM

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The treatment team includes the Medication Assistant Certified (MAC) Worker, the Medication Assistant Supervising (MAS) RN/LPN, Physician, the Qualified Intellectual Disabilities Professional, the Service Coordinator, the Administrator, the Pharmacist, other health care professionals, the person, and the person's family or guardian.
texts.text: The treatment team includes the Medication Assistant Certified (MAC) Worker, the Medication Assistant Supervising (MAS) RN/LPN, Physician, the Qualified Intellectual Disabilities Professional, the Service Coordinator, the Administrator, the Pharmacist, other health care professionals, the person, and the person's family or guardian.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES of the MAC WORKER
texts.text: RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES of the MAC WORKER

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The rights of the MAC Worker are as follows:
texts.text: The rights of the MAC Worker are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To receive proper education about medication assistance and orientation to the person.
texts.text: To receive proper education about medication assistance and orientation to the person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To be supported by the MAS nurse and other licensed professionals within the agency/program/facility.
texts.text: To be supported by the MAS nurse and other licensed professionals within the agency/program/facility.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To have direct access to the MAS Nurse 24/7 via physical presence, electronic or telephonic communication for direction, consultation, and collaboration (the MAS nurse shall be the First contact for any medical-medicinal issues).
texts.text: To have direct access to the MAS Nurse 24/7 via physical presence, electronic or telephonic communication for direction, consultation, and collaboration (the MAS nurse shall be the First contact for any medical-medicinal issues).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To have sufficient time to provide each person with the level of care that is needed.
texts.text: To have sufficient time to provide each person with the level of care that is needed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To work in a safe environment
texts.text: To work in a safe environment

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The responsibilities of the MAC Worker are as follows:
texts.text: The responsibilities of the MAC Worker are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To follow all policies, procedures, and regulations.
texts.text: To follow all policies, procedures, and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To be familiar with the person being cared for by the MAC Worker.
texts.text: To be familiar with the person being cared for by the MAC Worker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To pay attention to persons served while at work and listen to their concerns or complaints and report to the MAS nurse.
texts.text: To pay attention to persons served while at work and listen to their concerns or complaints and report to the MAS nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To ask your MAS nurse whenever you are unsure about any delegated tasks (i.e., Medication, Procedures).
texts.text: To ask your MAS nurse whenever you are unsure about any delegated tasks (i.e., Medication, Procedures).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To recognize that there is no 'dumb question' regarding persons' safety.
texts.text: To recognize that there is no 'dumb question' regarding persons' safety.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To stay connected to your MAS Nurse.
texts.text: To stay connected to your MAS Nurse.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE MAS NURSE
texts.text: RIGHTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE MAS NURSE

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The rights of the Nurse are as follows:
texts.text: The rights of the Nurse are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS RN or LPN delegating the task may, at any time, suspend or withdraw the delegation of tasks to MAC Workers.
texts.text: The MAS RN or LPN delegating the task may, at any time, suspend or withdraw the delegation of tasks to MAC Workers.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: [ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06(8)]
texts.text: [ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06(8)]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · ADMH approved education about the Nurse Delegation Program.
texts.text: ADMH approved education about the Nurse Delegation Program.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Adequate time to educate assigned MAC workers.
texts.text: Adequate time to educate assigned MAC workers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Freedom to select and delegate to MAC Workers based on the workers' ability and attitude.
texts.text: Freedom to select and delegate to MAC Workers based on the workers' ability and attitude.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · An adequate staffing ratio between the licensed professional nurse to MAC Workers should be maintained to provide safe management and adequate consultation.
texts.text: An adequate staffing ratio between the licensed professional nurse to MAC Workers should be maintained to provide safe management and adequate consultation.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAS nurse is part of the core treatment team and shall be included in the decisions concerning the person-served health care needs.
texts.text: MAS nurse is part of the core treatment team and shall be included in the decisions concerning the person-served health care needs.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The responsibilities of the Nurse are as follows:
texts.text: The responsibilities of the Nurse are as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To follow NDP guidelines and ALL related Federal and State Regulations.
texts.text: To follow NDP guidelines and ALL related Federal and State Regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To notify the agency administration if delegation has been suspended or revoked for any  MAC Worker.
texts.text: To notify the agency administration if delegation has been suspended or revoked for any  MAC Worker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · To notify agency administration and Coordinator of Nurse Delegation if the nurse license becomes encumbered . The MAS and /or MATT certificate becomes null and void if the license becomes encumbered.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Registered Nurse is responsible and accountable for the completion of a comprehensive assessment and evaluation of the patient's nursing care needs. The MAS LPN may initiate and document data elements of the comprehensive assessment. The outcome of the comprehensive assessment determines  the tasks that may be safely performed by unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings.
texts.text: The MAS Registered Nurse is responsible and accountable for the completion of a comprehensive assessment and evaluation of the patient's nursing care needs. The MAS LPN may initiate and document data elements of the comprehensive assessment. The outcome of the comprehensive assessment determines  the tasks that may be safely performed by unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(2) Assessment, Comprehensive The systematic collection and ANALYSIS of data including the physical, psychological, social, cultural, and spiritual aspects of the patient by the MAS RN for the purpose of judging a patient's health and illness status and actual or potential health needs.
texts.text: ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(2) Assessment, Comprehensive The systematic collection and ANALYSIS of data including the physical, psychological, social, cultural, and spiritual aspects of the patient by the MAS RN for the purpose of judging a patient's health and illness status and actual or potential health needs.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Nurse Delegation Program is implemented the same way in every program certified by ADMH.
texts.text: The Nurse Delegation Program is implemented the same way in every program certified by ADMH.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The first step of the Nurse Delegation Program is the MAS RN Comprehensive Assessment to be completed within 72 hours, plan of care completed, signed, and in the medical record within 10 days of admission of the person's needs. This assessment can be initiated by the MAS LPN. The purpose of the assessment is to determine if the needs of the person can be safely provided for by a MAC Worker OR if the person's needs are too complicated and require skilled nursing to safely meet their needs.
texts.text: The first step of the Nurse Delegation Program is the MAS RN Comprehensive Assessment to be completed within 72 hours, plan of care completed, signed, and in the medical record within 10 days of admission of the person's needs. This assessment can be initiated by the MAS LPN. The purpose of the assessment is to determine if the needs of the person can be safely provided for by a MAC Worker OR if the person's needs are too complicated and require skilled nursing to safely meet their needs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Once the MAS LPN has initiated the comprehensive assessment, the MAS RN must review and summarize the needs of the person. The document is not complete without the MAS RN's signature, credentials, and date. The MAS RN completes ALL nursing care plans. The MAS RN/LPN must communicate assessment findings and planned interventions to the treatment/interdisciplinary team, and especially to other delegating nurse(s) and MAC Worker(s). The MAS RN assessment must be completed:
texts.text: Once the MAS LPN has initiated the comprehensive assessment, the MAS RN must review and summarize the needs of the person. The document is not complete without the MAS RN's signature, credentials, and date. The MAS RN completes ALL nursing care plans. The MAS RN/LPN must communicate assessment findings and planned interventions to the treatment/interdisciplinary team, and especially to other delegating nurse(s) and MAC Worker(s). The MAS RN assessment must be completed:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Initially (completed within 72 hours, plan of care completed, signed and in the medical record within 10 days of admission)
texts.text: Initially (completed within 72 hours, plan of care completed, signed and in the medical record within 10 days of admission)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Any time there is a change in the person's status (initiated within 24 hours and plan of care updated, signed and in clinical record within 5 days of status change)
texts.text: Any time there is a change in the person's status (initiated within 24 hours and plan of care updated, signed and in clinical record within 5 days of status change)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Updated at least annually
texts.text: Updated at least annually

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Nursing Care Plans are updated by the MAS RN when the MAS RN assessment is Updated (change of status and annually). The MAS RN Assessment and Nursing Care Plans shall be part of the clinical record.
texts.text: Nursing Care Plans are updated by the MAS RN when the MAS RN assessment is Updated (change of status and annually). The MAS RN Assessment and Nursing Care Plans shall be part of the clinical record.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The second step of the Nurse Delegation Program is the MAS Nurse (RN/LPN) assessment of the person's ability to self-medicate. Criteria for the person who can self-medicate ,
texts.text: The second step of the Nurse Delegation Program is the MAS Nurse (RN/LPN) assessment of the person's ability to self-medicate. Criteria for the person who can self-medicate ,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The person can effectively verbalize understanding of the purpose of the medication(s)
texts.text: The person can effectively verbalize understanding of the purpose of the medication(s)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The person can effectively verbalize common possible side effects , including:
texts.text: The person can effectively verbalize common possible side effects , including:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i.  What to do if a dose is missed
texts.text: What to do if a dose is missed

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii.  What to do if extra dose(s) taken
texts.text: What to do if extra dose(s) taken

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii.  What to do if adverse reactions occur
texts.text: What to do if adverse reactions occur

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The person can recognize the medication(s)
texts.text: The person can recognize the medication(s)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Verbalize/demonstrate the steps of administration to include the correct med, time, and use of PRN medication, documentation
texts.text: Verbalize/demonstrate the steps of administration to include the correct med, time, and use of PRN medication, documentation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The person can perform a medication return demonstration, securing medication correctly.
texts.text: The person can perform a medication return demonstration, securing medication correctly.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Self-medicators are not required to have approval from the MAS nurse prior to PRN medication. All other NDP guidelines apply for self-medicators - meds must be locked/doublelocked as required.
texts.text: Self-medicators are not required to have approval from the MAS nurse prior to PRN medication. All other NDP guidelines apply for self-medicators - meds must be locked/doublelocked as required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Self-medication observation records (SMOR, SMAR, or MAR) must be documented.
texts.text: Self-medication observation records (SMOR, SMAR, or MAR) must be documented.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · There must be written accountability for ALL medication.
texts.text: There must be written accountability for ALL medication.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAC Worker must contact the MAS Nurse if there are any concerns or problems.
texts.text: MAC Worker must contact the MAS Nurse if there are any concerns or problems.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Example: PRN Tylenol 325mg 2 tablets every 4 to 6 hours for complaints of headache. The Nurse would only want to put enough Tylenol in the medication area for a couple of days. The nurse would have a count of how many are put in the med area and review the number of PRNs taken for accuracy. If the person served does not take PRNs according to the prescriber's orders, then he/she cannot fully self-medicate.
texts.text: Example: PRN Tylenol 325mg 2 tablets every 4 to 6 hours for complaints of headache. The Nurse would only want to put enough Tylenol in the medication area for a couple of days. The nurse would have a count of how many are put in the med area and review the number of PRNs taken for accuracy. If the person served does not take PRNs according to the prescriber's orders, then he/she cannot fully self-medicate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For persons who partially self-medicate or cannot self-medicate , the MAC Worker must contact the MAS Nurse before assisting with all PRN medications.
texts.text: For persons who partially self-medicate or cannot self-medicate , the MAC Worker must contact the MAS Nurse before assisting with all PRN medications.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The assessment of a person's ability to self-medicate must be done initially, any time there is a change in a person's status, and at least annually. There must be documentation in the person's medical record of the completed assessment.
texts.text: The assessment of a person's ability to self-medicate must be done initially, any time there is a change in a person's status, and at least annually. There must be documentation in the person's medical record of the completed assessment.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The family, person, nor the Agency have the right to demand self-medication when assessment by a MAS Nurse (RN/LPN) determines the person does not meet the criteria to self-medicate.
texts.text: The family, person, nor the Agency have the right to demand self-medication when assessment by a MAS Nurse (RN/LPN) determines the person does not meet the criteria to self-medicate.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Pill Planners, Pill Boxes, and Medication Dispensers
texts.text: Pill Planners, Pill Boxes, and Medication Dispensers

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A licensed nurse may sit with a person who is capable of self-medication administration while the person fills his/her pill box (this oversite cannot be delegated to a MAC Worker). The medications must be removed from the medication bottle/package and placed into the pill box by the person. The nurse is NOT allowed to pre-fill the pill box for the person. The MAS Nurse may NOT package or repackage medications, this includes selfmedication dispensers. ALL medications must be locked (double locked for controlled) and stored in a safe and secure area to ensure there is no unauthorized access.
texts.text: A licensed nurse may sit with a person who is capable of self-medication administration while the person fills his/her pill box (this oversite cannot be delegated to a MAC Worker). The medications must be removed from the medication bottle/package and placed into the pill box by the person. The nurse is NOT allowed to pre-fill the pill box for the person. The MAS Nurse may NOT package or repackage medications, this includes selfmedication dispensers. ALL medications must be locked (double locked for controlled) and stored in a safe and secure area to ensure there is no unauthorized access.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ***A MAC Worker may assist the person who can self-medicate by reminding him/her of medication times, but the person must administer the meds themselves.
texts.text: ***A MAC Worker may assist the person who can self-medicate by reminding him/her of medication times, but the person must administer the meds themselves.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Emergency Medications
texts.text: Emergency Medications

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Emergency medications prescribed for a person such as asthma inhalers, Epi-pens or nitroglycerine, etc. must be kept wherever the person receives services. The Agency is required to have a policy that addresses emergency medications, including who educates the MAC worker, who obtains medication, and who is responsible for checking the availability of the medication (For example the MAS Nurse assigned to the service area). The MAS Nurse must be contacted any time emergency medications are used. ALL medications are locked, and controlled medications are double-locked.
texts.text: Emergency medications prescribed for a person such as asthma inhalers, Epi-pens or nitroglycerine, etc. must be kept wherever the person receives services. The Agency is required to have a policy that addresses emergency medications, including who educates the MAC worker, who obtains medication, and who is responsible for checking the availability of the medication (For example the MAS Nurse assigned to the service area). The MAS Nurse must be contacted any time emergency medications are used. ALL medications are locked, and controlled medications are double-locked.

Direct supervision by a registered nurse is required for new graduates practicing on a temporary permit.
texts.text: *ABN Regulation 610-x-(19) Supervision, Direct: Responsible licensed nurse physically present in the facility and readily accessible to designate or prescribe a course of action or to give procedural guidance, direction, and periodic evaluation. Direct supervision by a registered nurse is required for new graduates practicing on a temporary permit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The licensed nurse shall delegate only after considering various factors, including but not limited to:
texts.text: The licensed nurse shall delegate only after considering various factors, including but not limited to:

texts.text: (b) Complexity of the delegated task.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (c) Health Status of the patient.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Supervision shall be provided to individuals to whom nursing functions or responsibilities are delegated or assigned.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: DELEGATING NURSES MUST BE AVAILABLE AND MUST RESPOND PROMPTLY (15 -30 MINUTES) TO ALL CALLS FROM MAC WORKERS.
texts.text: DELEGATING NURSES MUST BE AVAILABLE AND MUST RESPOND PROMPTLY (15 -30 MINUTES) TO ALL CALLS FROM MAC WORKERS.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The On-Call Nurse must be MAS trained with a current MAS Certification.
texts.text: The On-Call Nurse must be MAS trained with a current MAS Certification.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The On-Call MAS Nurse does not have to be the MAS Nurse who trained the MAC worker. The On-Call MAS Nurse may delegate to the Unlicensed MAC Worker.  Since all MAC Workers and MAS Nurses receive the same training, there will be consistency with the MAS-MAC Connection.
texts.text: The On-Call MAS Nurse does not have to be the MAS Nurse who trained the MAC worker. The On-Call MAS Nurse may delegate to the Unlicensed MAC Worker.  Since all MAC Workers and MAS Nurses receive the same training, there will be consistency with the MAS-MAC Connection.

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: What is the MAS-MAC Connection?

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAC Worker is an extension of the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: The MAC Worker is an extension of the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse is responsible and accountable for nursing care provided by ADMH Nurse Delegation Certified Programs.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse is responsible and accountable for nursing care provided by ADMH Nurse Delegation Certified Programs.

texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse is the knowledge base for the MAC Worker while the MAC Worker is the
texts.text: The MAS Nurse is the knowledge base for the MAC Worker while the MAC Worker is the

texts.label: text
texts.orig: eyes, ears, hands, and voice of the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: eyes, ears, hands, and voice of the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: each one needs the other.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The persons served by the agency are patients of the MAS Nurse.  This is comparable to a Nurse/Patient Assignment in a hospital setting. The nurse is required by the Nurse Practice Act to be responsible and accountable for nursing care .
texts.text: The persons served by the agency are patients of the MAS Nurse.  This is comparable to a Nurse/Patient Assignment in a hospital setting. The nurse is required by the Nurse Practice Act to be responsible and accountable for nursing care .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAC Worker shall have access to a MAS Nurse via physical presence, electronic or telephonic twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week without exception.
texts.text: The MAC Worker shall have access to a MAS Nurse via physical presence, electronic or telephonic twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week without exception.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse shall include information regarding how to contact him/her AND what to do if there is no response within 30 minutes.  Contact Information and instructions shall be available to the MAC Worker.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse shall include information regarding how to contact him/her AND what to do if there is no response within 30 minutes.  Contact Information and instructions shall be available to the MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: · A MAS Nurse shall be available to the MAC Worker 24/7.  The MAS Nurse needs to take calls only during the time he/she can be available for indirect and, if necessary, direct supervision of the MAC Workers.  This is a right of the MAC Worker and a responsibility of the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication errors would include any mistake with the 7 Rights of medication administration. ABN Regulation 610-X-6-.07(1) (j) (i-vii) Medication Administration and Safety state:
texts.text: Medication errors would include any mistake with the 7 Rights of medication administration. ABN Regulation 610-X-6-.07(1) (j) (i-vii) Medication Administration and Safety state:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall have applied knowledge of medication administration and safety, including safety precautions but not limited to:
texts.text: The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall have applied knowledge of medication administration and safety, including safety precautions but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) Right patient
texts.text: (i) Right patient

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Right medications
texts.text: (ii) Right medications

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) Right time
texts.text: (iii) Right time

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iv) Right dose
texts.text: (iv) Right dose

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (v) Right route
texts.text: (v) Right route

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (vi) Right reason
texts.text: (vi) Right reason

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (vii) Right documentation
texts.text: (vii) Right documentation

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ALL MEDICATION ERRORS COMMITTED BY LICENSED & UNLICENSED PERSONS SHALL BE REPORTED IN THE ADMH INCIDENT PREVENTION & MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.
texts.text: ALL MEDICATION ERRORS COMMITTED BY LICENSED & UNLICENSED PERSONS SHALL BE REPORTED IN THE ADMH INCIDENT PREVENTION & MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Medication Errors are entered into IPMS by TYPE:
texts.text: Medication Errors are entered into IPMS by TYPE:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Many medications are prescribed for use other than FDA classification. A 'wrong reason' medication error occurs when a medication is administered for a reason other than prescribed.
texts.text: Many medications are prescribed for use other than FDA classification. A 'wrong reason' medication error occurs when a medication is administered for a reason other than prescribed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Example #1: Benadryl prescribed for allergy relief cannot be used as a sleep agent. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.
texts.text: Example #1: Benadryl prescribed for allergy relief cannot be used as a sleep agent. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Example #2: Depakote prescribed for seizures cannot be used as a mood stabilizer. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.
texts.text: Example #2: Depakote prescribed for seizures cannot be used as a mood stabilizer. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Example #3: Lorazepam prescribed (PRN) as a pre-sedation medication cannot be used as a chemical restraint for behavioral issues. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.
texts.text: Example #3: Lorazepam prescribed (PRN) as a pre-sedation medication cannot be used as a chemical restraint for behavioral issues. Unless a separate order is obtained from a legally authorized prescriber.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Forgetting to give a dose of medication is called a 'missed dose'. This is also a medication error.
texts.text: Forgetting to give a dose of medication is called a 'missed dose'. This is also a medication error.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A 'wrong person' medication error is when someone is administered medication prescribed for another person.
texts.text: A 'wrong person' medication error is when someone is administered medication prescribed for another person.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A 'wrong medication' error is when a medication is given that has been discontinued, contaminated, expired, or is listed as an allergy.
texts.text: A 'wrong medication' error is when a medication is given that has been discontinued, contaminated, expired, or is listed as an allergy.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A 'wrong time' error occurs when the medication is given outside of the window of administration time (one hour before/one hour after MAR time).
texts.text: A 'wrong time' error occurs when the medication is given outside of the window of administration time (one hour before/one hour after MAR time).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A 'wrong dose' medication error is when a person receives more or less than the prescribed order.
texts.text: A 'wrong dose' medication error is when a person receives more or less than the prescribed order.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The severity of medication errors is noted in Levels - I, II, and  III.
texts.text: The severity of medication errors is noted in Levels - I, II, and  III.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Level I medication errors are called 'monitoring errors' . A Level I error is an incident in which the person experienced no or minimal adverse consequences AND no treatment or intervention other than monitoring or observation within the agency is required. Lack of appropriate documentation on the MAR after medication administration is a Level I medication error.
texts.text: Level I medication errors are called 'monitoring errors' . A Level I error is an incident in which the person experienced no or minimal adverse consequences AND no treatment or intervention other than monitoring or observation within the agency is required. Lack of appropriate documentation on the MAR after medication administration is a Level I medication error.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Level II medication error is called a 'treatment error'. A Level II medication error is an incident in which the person experienced short-term, reversible adverse consequences AND treatment or intervention in addition to monitoring is required. Sending a person to the emergency room, urgent care, or unscheduled Primary care physician in response to a medication error is a Level II medication error. An evaluation from a health care professional outside the agency.
texts.text: A Level II medication error is called a 'treatment error'. A Level II medication error is an incident in which the person experienced short-term, reversible adverse consequences AND treatment or intervention in addition to monitoring is required. Sending a person to the emergency room, urgent care, or unscheduled Primary care physician in response to a medication error is a Level II medication error. An evaluation from a health care professional outside the agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A Level III medication error is a sentinel (serious) event . A Level III medication error is an incident in which the person experienced life-threatening and/or permanent adverse consequences (loss of bodily function). Hospital admission in response to a medication error is a Level III medication error.
texts.text: A Level III medication error is a sentinel (serious) event . A Level III medication error is an incident in which the person experienced life-threatening and/or permanent adverse consequences (loss of bodily function). Hospital admission in response to a medication error is a Level III medication error.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The delegating MAS Nurse must be notified immediately of ALL medication errors upon discovery.
texts.text: The delegating MAS Nurse must be notified immediately of ALL medication errors upon discovery.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The NDP Coordinator is notified of Level II and III  medication errors within 24 hours.
texts.text: The NDP Coordinator is notified of Level II and III  medication errors within 24 hours.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Divisional Incident Prevention and Management Policies and Procedures are used to guide the MAS Nurse/Agency Administrator in reporting medication errors to ADMH. Medication errors must be included in the agency's Quality Assurance Plan, which will be reviewed during the Agency's Certification Survey.
texts.text: The Divisional Incident Prevention and Management Policies and Procedures are used to guide the MAS Nurse/Agency Administrator in reporting medication errors to ADMH. Medication errors must be included in the agency's Quality Assurance Plan, which will be reviewed during the Agency's Certification Survey.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Medication administration errors by different types of healthcare professionals including physicians, pharmacists, MAS RNs, and MAS LPNs, occur regularly in all clinical settings. A medication error does not necessarily constitute negligent care. Successful lawsuits occur when healthcare professionals violate the community standard of care and do not adhere to basic practices.
texts.text: Medication administration errors by different types of healthcare professionals including physicians, pharmacists, MAS RNs, and MAS LPNs, occur regularly in all clinical settings. A medication error does not necessarily constitute negligent care. Successful lawsuits occur when healthcare professionals violate the community standard of care and do not adhere to basic practices.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Each medication error must be evaluated on its merit. The occurrence of a medication error does not imply the MAC Worker or licensed professional is incompetent or negligent.
texts.text: Each medication error must be evaluated on its merit. The occurrence of a medication error does not imply the MAC Worker or licensed professional is incompetent or negligent.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Repeated medication errors despite re-education or flagrant, reckless behavior that causes risk to persons require immediate action for correction or revocation of MAC privileges. The MAS RN/MAS LPN HAS THE AUTHORITY TO DE-CERTIFY a MAC Worker.
texts.text: Repeated medication errors despite re-education or flagrant, reckless behavior that causes risk to persons require immediate action for correction or revocation of MAC privileges. The MAS RN/MAS LPN HAS THE AUTHORITY TO DE-CERTIFY a MAC Worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Agency Administrator/designee and the MAS Nurse must assess all Level II and Level III Medication errors within 24 hours of the discovery of the error.
texts.text: The Agency Administrator/designee and the MAS Nurse must assess all Level II and Level III Medication errors within 24 hours of the discovery of the error.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: MAC Certification is suspended for all Level II & III errors until the MAS Nurse has determined that the MAC Worker can resume MAC responsibilities OR the MAC Worker is decertified.
texts.text: MAC Certification is suspended for all Level II & III errors until the MAS Nurse has determined that the MAC Worker can resume MAC responsibilities OR the MAC Worker is decertified.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All Staff who input medication errors into the IMPS are required to know the TYPES and Levels of MEDICATION ERRORS.
texts.text: All Staff who input medication errors into the IMPS are required to know the TYPES and Levels of MEDICATION ERRORS.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Anytime there is a medication error other than a documentation error , the MAC worker is trained using the NDP 21 Medication Error Training Form .
texts.text: Anytime there is a medication error other than a documentation error , the MAC worker is trained using the NDP 21 Medication Error Training Form .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Delegation Form (NDP-2)
texts.text: The Delegation Form (NDP-2)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Delegation is a legal action that is not official until the delegation form is signed by the MAC Worker and the delegating MAS Nurse(s).
texts.text: Delegation is a legal action that is not official until the delegation form is signed by the MAC Worker and the delegating MAS Nurse(s).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Completing the MAC Training IS NOT delegation
texts.text: Completing the MAC Training IS NOT delegation

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Every MAC Worker must have a delegation form. The MAC Worker must sign the form acknowledging completion of the Alabama Board of Nursing approve MAC I and MAC II training AND the willingness to accept the responsibility to assist with medication administration and other delegated nursing tasks.
texts.text: Every MAC Worker must have a delegation form. The MAC Worker must sign the form acknowledging completion of the Alabama Board of Nursing approve MAC I and MAC II training AND the willingness to accept the responsibility to assist with medication administration and other delegated nursing tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The delegating MAS Nurse is responsible for the supervision of the MAC Worker and the nursing care provided in ALL ADMH Certified Community Programs
texts.text: The delegating MAS Nurse is responsible for the supervision of the MAC Worker and the nursing care provided in ALL ADMH Certified Community Programs

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The date the MAC Worker completed MAC I is documented in the required space.
texts.text: The date the MAC Worker completed MAC I is documented in the required space.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Column 1 : 'DATE MAC II COMPLETED', is the date the delegating MAS Nurse verifies the successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II training and the date of verification of competency of all delegated nursing tasks on the skills checklist.
texts.text: Column 1 : 'DATE MAC II COMPLETED', is the date the delegating MAS Nurse verifies the successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II training and the date of verification of competency of all delegated nursing tasks on the skills checklist.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Column 2 , 'DATE DELEGATION SUSPENDED', is the date the MAC Worker's delegation privileges are stopped for a brief period (temporary). The MAS Nurse must document the reason for the suspension and the planned corrective action in the 'comments/notes' section on the back of the delegation form. Suspensions should be documented on MAC Direct Annual Supervision Form.
texts.text: Column 2 , 'DATE DELEGATION SUSPENDED', is the date the MAC Worker's delegation privileges are stopped for a brief period (temporary). The MAS Nurse must document the reason for the suspension and the planned corrective action in the 'comments/notes' section on the back of the delegation form. Suspensions should be documented on MAC Direct Annual Supervision Form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Column 3: This contains the date delegation begins.
texts.text: Column 3: This contains the date delegation begins.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Column 4: MAS Nurse signature, credentials, and date.
texts.text: Column 4: MAS Nurse signature, credentials, and date.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: By signing this form, the MAS Nurse has acknowledged that the MAC Worker has satisfactorily completed the MAC II training and Skills competency checklist. The MAS Nurse signs and dates each time action, i.e., successful completion of MAC II or redelegation after suspension of delegation duties.
texts.text: By signing this form, the MAS Nurse has acknowledged that the MAC Worker has satisfactorily completed the MAC II training and Skills competency checklist. The MAS Nurse signs and dates each time action, i.e., successful completion of MAC II or redelegation after suspension of delegation duties.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ABN Regulation 610-X-6-.11(3) Assignment, Delegation, and Supervision state:
texts.text: ABN Regulation 610-X-6-.11(3) Assignment, Delegation, and Supervision state:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall delegate only after considering various factors including but not limited to:
texts.text: 'The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall delegate only after considering various factors including but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience of the person receiving the delegation
texts.text: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience of the person receiving the delegation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Complexity of the delegated tasks
texts.text: (b) Complexity of the delegated tasks

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Health status of the patient'
texts.text: (c) Health status of the patient'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The delegation form must be maintained in the active MAC Worker file throughout the duration of the delegation.
texts.text: The delegation form must be maintained in the active MAC Worker file throughout the duration of the delegation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All MAC Workers must have (4) hours of recertification/update training performed by a MAS Nurse with a current certificate. The 4-hour recertification covers the agency's policy and procedures related to NDP and a review of all delegated tasks at a minimum every two (2) years.
texts.text: All MAC Workers must have (4) hours of recertification/update training performed by a MAS Nurse with a current certificate. The 4-hour recertification covers the agency's policy and procedures related to NDP and a review of all delegated tasks at a minimum every two (2) years.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When a MAS Nurse begins to work at an agency where another MAS Nurse was previously the delegating nurse , the new MAS Nurse must verify the following:
texts.text: When a MAS Nurse begins to work at an agency where another MAS Nurse was previously the delegating nurse , the new MAS Nurse must verify the following:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ALL MAS Nurses must verify the following prior to signing the delegation form:
texts.text: ALL MAS Nurses must verify the following prior to signing the delegation form:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · MAC Worker has an HS diploma/GED/College Transcript
texts.text: MAC Worker has an HS diploma/GED/College Transcript

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful completion of MAC I as evidenced by certificates (note date on delegation form)
texts.text: Successful completion of MAC I as evidenced by certificates (note date on delegation form)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II as evidenced by a certificate signed by a MAS Nurse (If the certificate is not available, the MAS Nurse must teach 8 hours of MAC II)
texts.text: Successful completion of eight (8) hours of MAC II as evidenced by a certificate signed by a MAS Nurse (If the certificate is not available, the MAS Nurse must teach 8 hours of MAC II)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Competency of the MAC Worker to perform all nursing tasks delegated as indicated by completion of the Skills Checklist (date must be noted on delegation form).
texts.text: Competency of the MAC Worker to perform all nursing tasks delegated as indicated by completion of the Skills Checklist (date must be noted on delegation form).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The date noted on the NDP skills checklist is the date that must be documented on the delegation form.
texts.text: The date noted on the NDP skills checklist is the date that must be documented on the delegation form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When there is a team of Delegating Nurses at an agency, the New MAS Nurse/s may use their nursing judgment to determine if the training/competency verification done by other MAS nurses is adequate. The NEW MAS NURSE MUST DOCUMENT that they have accepted the delegation by signing the Delegation form.
texts.text: When there is a team of Delegating Nurses at an agency, the New MAS Nurse/s may use their nursing judgment to determine if the training/competency verification done by other MAS nurses is adequate. The NEW MAS NURSE MUST DOCUMENT that they have accepted the delegation by signing the Delegation form.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: REVOCATION/DECERTIFICATION OF DELEGATION ( NDP 15) THIS FORM HAS TWO PURPOSES:
texts.text: REVOCATION/DECERTIFICATION OF DELEGATION ( NDP 15) THIS FORM HAS TWO PURPOSES:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The first is when delegation privileges are permanently revoked, a 'Revocation/Decertification of Delegation Form, NDP 15, must be completed by the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: The first is when delegation privileges are permanently revoked, a 'Revocation/Decertification of Delegation Form, NDP 15, must be completed by the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A copy should be placed in the MAC Worker file
texts.text: A copy should be placed in the MAC Worker file

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If this action occurs, it should be documented on the Delegation form and Supervision form as well
texts.text: If this action occurs, it should be documented on the Delegation form and Supervision form as well

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When a MAS Nurse leaves an agency where he/she has been the delegating nurse, as evidenced by his/her signature on the delegation form, revocation of the MAC Worker /s privileges may be documented on the letter of resignation. The professional letter of resignation, including the revocation of MAC Worker/s, shall be maintained in the MAS Nurse's personnel file.
texts.text: When a MAS Nurse leaves an agency where he/she has been the delegating nurse, as evidenced by his/her signature on the delegation form, revocation of the MAC Worker /s privileges may be documented on the letter of resignation. The professional letter of resignation, including the revocation of MAC Worker/s, shall be maintained in the MAS Nurse's personnel file.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: OR the MAS Nurse may complete the Revocation/Decertification form and list (attach a list) of the MAC WORKERS
texts.text: OR the MAS Nurse may complete the Revocation/Decertification form and list (attach a list) of the MAC WORKERS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NDP personnel files shall be maintained for as long as the employee is active in the agency.
texts.text: NDP personnel files shall be maintained for as long as the employee is active in the agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Inactive files shall be maintained for a minimum of five years.
texts.text: Inactive files shall be maintained for a minimum of five years.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MAC Annual Direct Supervision Form (NDP-3)
texts.text: MAC Annual Direct Supervision Form (NDP-3)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This form is used to document direct supervision ( face-to-face ) of MAC Workers by the MAS RN/MAS LPN. ABN regulation 610-X-2-.06(19), 'Supervision, Direct' states: ' Responsible licensed nurse physically present in the facility and readily accessible to designate or prescribe a course of action or to give procedural guidance, direction, and periodic evaluation.'
texts.text: This form is used to document direct supervision ( face-to-face ) of MAC Workers by the MAS RN/MAS LPN. ABN regulation 610-X-2-.06(19), 'Supervision, Direct' states: ' Responsible licensed nurse physically present in the facility and readily accessible to designate or prescribe a course of action or to give procedural guidance, direction, and periodic evaluation.'

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The MAS Nurse must provide direct supervision, face-to-face, at least annually and/or PRN.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse must provide direct supervision, face-to-face, at least annually and/or PRN.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The direct supervision form has a 90-day grace period.
texts.text: The direct supervision form has a 90-day grace period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Direct supervision will be documented as needed, in addition to the annual requirement (Retraining, reprimand, suspension, and decertification)
texts.text: Direct supervision will be documented as needed, in addition to the annual requirement (Retraining, reprimand, suspension, and decertification)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The rating scale ranges from '1' - very poor, to '5' - outstanding. A '1' or '5' rating must be accompanied by comments documented by the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: The rating scale ranges from '1' - very poor, to '5' - outstanding. A '1' or '5' rating must be accompanied by comments documented by the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o REMEMBER: A SCORE OF 1 REQUIRES A PLAN TO ASSIST THE MAC WORKER ACHIEVE COMPETENCY
texts.text: o REMEMBER: A SCORE OF 1 REQUIRES A PLAN TO ASSIST THE MAC WORKER ACHIEVE COMPETENCY

texts.text: The MAS Nurse and the MAC Worker must discuss the evaluation, and sign, and date the form.
