texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Level II/III Medication Error Report Form (NDP 4)
texts.text: Level II/III Medication Error Report Form (NDP 4)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Level II/III Medication Error Report Form should be completed by the MAS RN/MAS LPN any time a Level II/III error occurs . The form shall be emailed directly to the ADMH/NDP office within 24 hours of notification/discovery of the error. All requested information shall be provided with a 'description of the error' focusing on the outcome to the person - signs, symptoms, ER visit, hospital admission, etc. For Level II & III errors, the agency shall have a plan of correction to prevent future occurrences. The MAS Nurse shall describe a plan of correction on the NDP 4 form.
texts.text: The Level II/III Medication Error Report Form should be completed by the MAS RN/MAS LPN any time a Level II/III error occurs . The form shall be emailed directly to the ADMH/NDP office within 24 hours of notification/discovery of the error. All requested information shall be provided with a 'description of the error' focusing on the outcome to the person - signs, symptoms, ER visit, hospital admission, etc. For Level II & III errors, the agency shall have a plan of correction to prevent future occurrences. The MAS Nurse shall describe a plan of correction on the NDP 4 form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Anytime 'other' is noted a clear explanation should be provided.
texts.text: Anytime 'other' is noted a clear explanation should be provided.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Forms included in the Divisional Incident Prevention and Management Policies and Procedures must be used to report ALL medication errors, Level I, II, AND III, to the ADMH.
texts.text: Forms included in the Divisional Incident Prevention and Management Policies and Procedures must be used to report ALL medication errors, Level I, II, AND III, to the ADMH.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: THIS FORM IS FOR NURSES ONLY
texts.text: THIS FORM IS FOR NURSES ONLY

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Only LEVEL II OR LEVEL III errors are to be reported using this form. The purpose is to get information from the MAS Nurse related to how the incident occurred, the person's status after a Level 2 and Level 3 error, and the agency's plans to prevent future errors. This is in addition to reporting to ADMH using the required divisional reporting forms.
texts.text: Only LEVEL II OR LEVEL III errors are to be reported using this form. The purpose is to get information from the MAS Nurse related to how the incident occurred, the person's status after a Level 2 and Level 3 error, and the agency's plans to prevent future errors. This is in addition to reporting to ADMH using the required divisional reporting forms.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The form shall be emailed to the NDP Director within 24 hours of notification/discovery of a Level II or III medication error
texts.text: The form shall be emailed to the NDP Director within 24 hours of notification/discovery of a Level II or III medication error

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: REMEMBER
texts.text: REMEMBER

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ALL MED ERRORS, LEVEL I, II, AND III MUST BE REPORTED TO ADMH. THE DIVISIONAL INCIDENT AND PREVENTION MANAGEMENT PROCEDURE AND FORMS MUST BE USED TO REPORT ALL MED ERRORS.
texts.text: ALL MED ERRORS, LEVEL I, II, AND III MUST BE REPORTED TO ADMH. THE DIVISIONAL INCIDENT AND PREVENTION MANAGEMENT PROCEDURE AND FORMS MUST BE USED TO REPORT ALL MED ERRORS.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Self-Medication Administration Assessment Form (NDP 5)
texts.text: Self-Medication Administration Assessment Form (NDP 5)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This form documents the assessment of a person's ability to self-administer medications by a MAS RN/MAS LPN. This form shall be completed within seventy-two hours of admission, annually, and any time the person has a change in status that affects their ability to self-medicate. Until the self-medication administration assessment form is completed, the person shall not be allowed to self-medicate and should be assisted with medication administration by a MAC Worker or a nurse. MAC workers must be under the supervision of a MAS RN/MAS LPN.
texts.text: This form documents the assessment of a person's ability to self-administer medications by a MAS RN/MAS LPN. This form shall be completed within seventy-two hours of admission, annually, and any time the person has a change in status that affects their ability to self-medicate. Until the self-medication administration assessment form is completed, the person shall not be allowed to self-medicate and should be assisted with medication administration by a MAC Worker or a nurse. MAC workers must be under the supervision of a MAS RN/MAS LPN.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This form must be included in the person's medical record. The agency's policies and procedures must state where in the medical record the form will be filed. The assessment must be available for review by ADMH Certification Surveyors and/or other authorized personnel upon request. A copy of the self-medication assessment shall be available to the MAC worker.
texts.text: This form must be included in the person's medical record. The agency's policies and procedures must state where in the medical record the form will be filed. The assessment must be available for review by ADMH Certification Surveyors and/or other authorized personnel upon request. A copy of the self-medication assessment shall be available to the MAC worker.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NDP supports individualizing and maximizing the people served in the certified ADMH program's right to independence, choice, privacy, and dignity. Assessing for safe and accurate medication administration is the MAS nurse's responsibility and should be completed with the expectation that the people served in ADMH-certified community programs are both encouraged and allowed to maintain as much independence as possible, including the right to retain control of their medications when it can be done safely. A person with the mental and physical capacity to develop increased independence in medication administration should be supported with selfadministration instruction/education/training.
texts.text: NDP supports individualizing and maximizing the people served in the certified ADMH program's right to independence, choice, privacy, and dignity. Assessing for safe and accurate medication administration is the MAS nurse's responsibility and should be completed with the expectation that the people served in ADMH-certified community programs are both encouraged and allowed to maintain as much independence as possible, including the right to retain control of their medications when it can be done safely. A person with the mental and physical capacity to develop increased independence in medication administration should be supported with selfadministration instruction/education/training.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse is an advocate for people served through ADMH-certified programs.  Nurses should document goals and/or rationale to promote independence with medication administration when possible. MAS Nurses shall document any pertinent information related to medication administration.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse is an advocate for people served through ADMH-certified programs.  Nurses should document goals and/or rationale to promote independence with medication administration when possible. MAS Nurses shall document any pertinent information related to medication administration.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MAC Worker Call Log (NDP 6)
texts.text: MAC Worker Call Log (NDP 6)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAC Worker call log shall be used to document all calls from MAC Workers to MAS Nurses. Agencies that use electronic medical records to document calls between the MAC Worker and the MAS Nurse shall mirror this form. NDP 6 is a mandatory form. If an Agency has an EHR this form is used as the backup. The agency's policies and procedures must specifically state what form/method will be used to document ALL communication between the MAC Worker and the MAS Nurse. A PRN medication shall be documented on the call log. A MAS Nurse shall assess the need for PRN before administration.
texts.text: The MAC Worker call log shall be used to document all calls from MAC Workers to MAS Nurses. Agencies that use electronic medical records to document calls between the MAC Worker and the MAS Nurse shall mirror this form. NDP 6 is a mandatory form. If an Agency has an EHR this form is used as the backup. The agency's policies and procedures must specifically state what form/method will be used to document ALL communication between the MAC Worker and the MAS Nurse. A PRN medication shall be documented on the call log. A MAS Nurse shall assess the need for PRN before administration.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Regardless of the method used to document MAC Worker communication with the MAS Nurse, the MAS Nurse shall review the documentation at least monthly to verify that instructions were followed, or to follow up on pertinent issues/problems. The agency policy and procedure shall state how the MAS Nurse will document that communication has been reviewed.
texts.text: Regardless of the method used to document MAC Worker communication with the MAS Nurse, the MAS Nurse shall review the documentation at least monthly to verify that instructions were followed, or to follow up on pertinent issues/problems. The agency policy and procedure shall state how the MAS Nurse will document that communication has been reviewed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAC Worker Call log is not a part of the person's medical record, however, there may be issues noted on the MAC Worker Call Log that may also be addressed in the medical record as required by agency policy and procedure. A Call Log may include documentation for more than one person in the Agency. The form must be maintained by the agency for a minimum of five years.
texts.text: The MAC Worker Call log is not a part of the person's medical record, however, there may be issues noted on the MAC Worker Call Log that may also be addressed in the medical record as required by agency policy and procedure. A Call Log may include documentation for more than one person in the Agency. The form must be maintained by the agency for a minimum of five years.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Certificate of Completion (NDP 7a)
texts.text: Certificate of Completion (NDP 7a)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This form is provided to be used as a template for certificates of completion for the MAC II Training. Saving as a template allows agencies to type the agency's name in the designated place  for  future  use.  All  agencies  shall  use  a  certificate  of  completion  to  facilitate standardization throughout the State. The certificate shall include the following statement: has completed a minimum of eight (8) hours of MAC II training by a MAS Nurse with current ADMH approval, using ABN approved curriculum . The certificate must include the date of training and expiration date.  The certificate shall have the signature of the MAS nurse with credentials.
texts.text: This form is provided to be used as a template for certificates of completion for the MAC II Training. Saving as a template allows agencies to type the agency's name in the designated place  for  future  use.  All  agencies  shall  use  a  certificate  of  completion  to  facilitate standardization throughout the State. The certificate shall include the following statement: has completed a minimum of eight (8) hours of MAC II training by a MAS Nurse with current ADMH approval, using ABN approved curriculum . The certificate must include the date of training and expiration date.  The certificate shall have the signature of the MAS nurse with credentials.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Certificates  are  to  be  maintained  in  the  MAC  files  for  the  duration  of  employment.  The certificates must be available to ADMH Monitors/Certification Surveyors upon request.
texts.text: Certificates  are  to  be  maintained  in  the  MAC  files  for  the  duration  of  employment.  The certificates must be available to ADMH Monitors/Certification Surveyors upon request.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAC II certificate is given upon successful completion of MAC II Training (a minimum of eight hours).
texts.text: The MAC II certificate is given upon successful completion of MAC II Training (a minimum of eight hours).

texts.orig: MAC I MUST BE COMPLETED BEFORE MAC II TRAINING AS EVIDENCED BY THE MAC I DOCUMENTATION.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Certificate of Recertification (NDP 7b)
texts.text: Certificate of Recertification (NDP 7b)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The MAC Update/Recertification certificate is given upon completion of the required four hours of MAC Update Training every two years. The certificate shall include the following statement: has completed a minimum of four (4) hours of MAC Recertification training, using the NDP MAC Update/Recertification guidelines, including review of all delegated tasks.
texts.text: The MAC Update/Recertification certificate is given upon completion of the required four hours of MAC Update Training every two years. The certificate shall include the following statement: has completed a minimum of four (4) hours of MAC Recertification training, using the NDP MAC Update/Recertification guidelines, including review of all delegated tasks.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Certificates  are  to  be  maintained  in  the  MAC  files  for  the  duration  of  employment.  The certificates must be available to ADMH Monitors/Certification Surveyors upon request.
texts.text: Certificates  are  to  be  maintained  in  the  MAC  files  for  the  duration  of  employment.  The certificates must be available to ADMH Monitors/Certification Surveyors upon request.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MAS RN Assessment (NDP 8)
texts.text: MAS RN Assessment (NDP 8)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NDP 8 is an optional form. The MAS RN Comprehensive assessment is NOT optional. It is REQUIRED. Agencies may use their assessment as long as it contains the same information as NDP 8. ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06 ADMH Residential Community Programs states:
texts.text: NDP 8 is an optional form. The MAS RN Comprehensive assessment is NOT optional. It is REQUIRED. Agencies may use their assessment as long as it contains the same information as NDP 8. ABN Regulation 610-X-7-.06 ADMH Residential Community Programs states:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ' The MAS RN is accountable for determining the tasks that may be safely performed by the unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings following appropriate training and demonstration of competency.'
texts.text: ' The MAS RN is accountable for determining the tasks that may be safely performed by the unlicensed assistive personnel in residential community mental health settings following appropriate training and demonstration of competency.'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The method used by a MAS RN to make this determination is the performance of a comprehensive assessment as defined by ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(2):
texts.text: The method used by a MAS RN to make this determination is the performance of a comprehensive assessment as defined by ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.06(2):

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'the systematic collection and analysis of data including the physical, psychological, social, cultural and spiritual aspects of the patient by the MAS RN to judge a patient's health and illness status and actual or potential health needs.
texts.text: 'the systematic collection and analysis of data including the physical, psychological, social, cultural and spiritual aspects of the patient by the MAS RN to judge a patient's health and illness status and actual or potential health needs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The comprehensive assessment includes patient history, physical examination, analysis of the data collected, and development of the patient plan of care, implementation, and evaluation of the plan of care.'
texts.text: The comprehensive assessment includes patient history, physical examination, analysis of the data collected, and development of the patient plan of care, implementation, and evaluation of the plan of care.'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The agency and/or MAS RN may use a form of choice as directed by the agency's policies and procedures to document the required elements of the Comprehensive Assessment. The MAS RN Assessment form NDP 8 was developed to meet the elements required by the ABN regulation.
texts.text: The agency and/or MAS RN may use a form of choice as directed by the agency's policies and procedures to document the required elements of the Comprehensive Assessment. The MAS RN Assessment form NDP 8 was developed to meet the elements required by the ABN regulation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The ABN regulations governing the Practice of Practical Nursing (Practice), 610-X-6.05(1) (e) states:
texts.text: The ABN regulations governing the Practice of Practical Nursing (Practice), 610-X-6.05(1) (e) states:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'The practice of practical nursing includes but is not limited to conducting and documenting data elements of the comprehensive assessment.'
texts.text: 'The practice of practical nursing includes but is not limited to conducting and documenting data elements of the comprehensive assessment.'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This allows the MAS LPN to assist the MAS RN in the comprehensive assessment by the completion of pages 1-6 of form NDP 8. The MAS LPN must sign and date at the noted place on  the  form.  The  MAS  RN  shall  complete  the  systems  review  as  evidenced  by  his/her signature/date/credentials noted on the form.
texts.text: This allows the MAS LPN to assist the MAS RN in the comprehensive assessment by the completion of pages 1-6 of form NDP 8. The MAS LPN must sign and date at the noted place on  the  form.  The  MAS  RN  shall  complete  the  systems  review  as  evidenced  by  his/her signature/date/credentials noted on the form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The outcome of the MAS RN Comprehensive Assessment determines if the person can be safely cared for by a MAC Worker or if the person's needs are so complicated that they require skilled nursing services.
texts.text: The outcome of the MAS RN Comprehensive Assessment determines if the person can be safely cared for by a MAC Worker or if the person's needs are so complicated that they require skilled nursing services.

texts.text: All MAC Training must be documented on this form . The 'time' section of the form must have a time range, i.e., 8A-5P or 10A-2P. The date of completion for MAC II must be noted as requested on the form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Check the type of training being conducted. State the date of completion of a minimum of eight (8) hours of MAC II Training. The 8 hours may be split between multiple days.
texts.text: Check the type of training being conducted. State the date of completion of a minimum of eight (8) hours of MAC II Training. The 8 hours may be split between multiple days.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NDP Skills Checklist (NDP 13)
texts.text: NDP Skills Checklist (NDP 13)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Unlicensed staff working in All ADMH Certified Programs who will be assisting persons served with the nursing task(s) including but not limited to assisting with medication administration must have a MAS RN /MAS LPN validate the staff's competency for all delegated tasks (s).
texts.text: Unlicensed staff working in All ADMH Certified Programs who will be assisting persons served with the nursing task(s) including but not limited to assisting with medication administration must have a MAS RN /MAS LPN validate the staff's competency for all delegated tasks (s).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The NDP Skills Check List is a standardized and mandatory checklist. This is the only form to be used for validating the competency of unlicensed staff.
texts.text: The NDP Skills Check List is a standardized and mandatory checklist. This is the only form to be used for validating the competency of unlicensed staff.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · It is the MAS Nurse's responsibility to determine whether the unlicensed staff demonstrates competency in performing the tasks by using the guidelines and checklist.
texts.text: It is the MAS Nurse's responsibility to determine whether the unlicensed staff demonstrates competency in performing the tasks by using the guidelines and checklist.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · This form is to be used when the MAC is initially trained and for recertification/update.
texts.text: This form is to be used when the MAC is initially trained and for recertification/update.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Directions for completing the NDP Skills Check List
texts.text: Directions for completing the NDP Skills Check List

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. The name of the staff and MAS Nurse is PRINTED on page one of the checklist.
texts.text: The name of the staff and MAS Nurse is PRINTED on page one of the checklist.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. All documentation on the checklist is to be in ink (Black).
texts.text: All documentation on the checklist is to be in ink (Black).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The MAS Nurse/(s) completing the Skills check-off shall sign in the appropriate signature column.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse/(s) completing the Skills check-off shall sign in the appropriate signature column.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. MAS Nurse documents the date of skill check off
texts.text: MAS Nurse documents the date of skill check off

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. When a staff has demonstrated competency for a task, the staff will initial in the designated block.  If  the  staff  needs  further  training  in  an  area,  this  should  be  noted  in  the  designated 'comments' section on the last page of the document.
texts.text: When a staff has demonstrated competency for a task, the staff will initial in the designated block.  If  the  staff  needs  further  training  in  an  area,  this  should  be  noted  in  the  designated 'comments' section on the last page of the document.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. Section I, VI, and VII - Competency may be determined by demonstration or by written test.
texts.text: Section I, VI, and VII - Competency may be determined by demonstration or by written test.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7. Sections II-V- The staff must be observed performing each delegated task/skill initially and be able to verbalize and demonstrate how the task would be performed for recertification/update.
texts.text: Sections II-V- The staff must be observed performing each delegated task/skill initially and be able to verbalize and demonstrate how the task would be performed for recertification/update.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. The MAS Nurse signs and dates that the demonstration has occurred. The MAC Worker must initial and date the checklist after the completion of the tasks.
texts.text: The MAS Nurse signs and dates that the demonstration has occurred. The MAC Worker must initial and date the checklist after the completion of the tasks.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. Additional validated tasks may be added to the original form and signed/dated by the MAS nurse and staff later OR a new checklist may be used and filed in the MAC file.
texts.text: Additional validated tasks may be added to the original form and signed/dated by the MAS nurse and staff later OR a new checklist may be used and filed in the MAC file.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. The 'comment' section may be used to document any additional information, including a signature.
texts.text: The 'comment' section may be used to document any additional information, including a signature.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 11. In the second column the MAS nurse can document the review of skills as needed and MAC Update completion every two years.
texts.text: In the second column the MAS nurse can document the review of skills as needed and MAC Update completion every two years.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 12. The last page is a note page where the MAS nurse can document any special/other training.
texts.text: The last page is a note page where the MAS nurse can document any special/other training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 13. The checklist must be maintained in the MAC File.
texts.text: The checklist must be maintained in the MAC File.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The following guidelines and attachments are provided to assist with training and competency validation as well as providing the minimum standards for all unlicensed staff assisting with mediations and other delegated tasks.
texts.text: The following guidelines and attachments are provided to assist with training and competency validation as well as providing the minimum standards for all unlicensed staff assisting with mediations and other delegated tasks.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Health Care Practitioner Consultation Form (NDP 14) Optional but must have a process for communicating with other healthcare providers
texts.text: Health Care Practitioner Consultation Form (NDP 14) Optional but must have a process for communicating with other healthcare providers

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Health Care Practitioner (HCP) Form may be used to accompany persons to all health care appointments and document the reason for the visit.  Many HCPs have stated that person(s) will arrive for appointments and have no knowledge regarding the reason for the visit. As noted on the form, the reason for the visit is noted in the first section. The last section of the form is where the HCP can document current findings, new diagnoses/meds, and any other orders. The second page of the form was designed to assist the MAS Nurse in following up after the person returns from the HCP.
texts.text: The Health Care Practitioner (HCP) Form may be used to accompany persons to all health care appointments and document the reason for the visit.  Many HCPs have stated that person(s) will arrive for appointments and have no knowledge regarding the reason for the visit. As noted on the form, the reason for the visit is noted in the first section. The last section of the form is where the HCP can document current findings, new diagnoses/meds, and any other orders. The second page of the form was designed to assist the MAS Nurse in following up after the person returns from the HCP.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The use of the form is optional; however, the agency shall have some method /format for informing all HCPs of the reason for the visit and any other pertinent information. The agency's policies and procedures shall state the specific method/format used to communicate this information to HCPs and where the required follow-up by the MAS Nurse will be found in the medical record.
texts.text: The use of the form is optional; however, the agency shall have some method /format for informing all HCPs of the reason for the visit and any other pertinent information. The agency's policies and procedures shall state the specific method/format used to communicate this information to HCPs and where the required follow-up by the MAS Nurse will be found in the medical record.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MAC Delegation Revocation/Decertification Form (NDP 15)
texts.text: MAC Delegation Revocation/Decertification Form (NDP 15)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This form documents the revocation of the legal action of delegation. This form must be completed anytime delegation privileges are permanently removed.
texts.text: This form documents the revocation of the legal action of delegation. This form must be completed anytime delegation privileges are permanently removed.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The form is completed by the MAS Nurse.  The effective date of the revocation is documented in the appropriate space. A copy of the revocation form should also be placed in the appropriate MAC file.
texts.text: The form is completed by the MAS Nurse.  The effective date of the revocation is documented in the appropriate space. A copy of the revocation form should also be placed in the appropriate MAC file.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When a MAS Nurse leaves an agency, the professional standard is to give a 30-day notice. Agency P & P shall address reasonable notice for MAS Nurse's resignation revocation shall be documented on the form. The completed form(s) shall accompany a letter of resignation, or the MAS Nurse can include in the letter of resignation the revocation of MAC workers. The date of the revocation shall be included in the letter of resignation. A copy of the revocation form and resignation letter shall be filed in the MAS Nurse's personnel file.
texts.text: When a MAS Nurse leaves an agency, the professional standard is to give a 30-day notice. Agency P & P shall address reasonable notice for MAS Nurse's resignation revocation shall be documented on the form. The completed form(s) shall accompany a letter of resignation, or the MAS Nurse can include in the letter of resignation the revocation of MAC workers. The date of the revocation shall be included in the letter of resignation. A copy of the revocation form and resignation letter shall be filed in the MAS Nurse's personnel file.

texts.text: ABN Regulation 610-X-2-.08(1) states:

texts.label: text

texts.text: NOTES TO THE MAS NURSE

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The MAS Nurse must cover the following information in ALL MAC II Training .
texts.text: The MAS Nurse must cover the following information in ALL MAC II Training .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: First Aid
texts.text: First Aid

texts.label: text
texts.orig: First Aid is used in emergencies - falls, accidents, injuries, etc. The performance of First Aid does not require an order from a legally authorized prescriber.
texts.text: First Aid is used in emergencies - falls, accidents, injuries, etc. The performance of First Aid does not require an order from a legally authorized prescriber.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The contents of First Aid kits are approved by the MAS RN/MAS LPN. No items included in the First Aid kits are considered PRN medications. OTC and PRN medications are required to have a prescriber's order and are not included in the First Aid Kit.  The First Aid Kit shall be always accessible to the MAC Workers.  Any item in the First Aid kit, including  triple antibiotic ointments (TAO) and/or anti-itch creams, may be used by the MAC Worker as directed by the MAS Nurse during First Aid training. Remind the MAC Worker to always check the person's allergies . In the case of First Aid the MAC should care for the person first, then call the MAS Nurse.
texts.text: The contents of First Aid kits are approved by the MAS RN/MAS LPN. No items included in the First Aid kits are considered PRN medications. OTC and PRN medications are required to have a prescriber's order and are not included in the First Aid Kit.  The First Aid Kit shall be always accessible to the MAC Workers.  Any item in the First Aid kit, including  triple antibiotic ointments (TAO) and/or anti-itch creams, may be used by the MAC Worker as directed by the MAS Nurse during First Aid training. Remind the MAC Worker to always check the person's allergies . In the case of First Aid the MAC should care for the person first, then call the MAS Nurse.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Anytime First Aid is used, some incident has caused a change in the status of the person. The MAC Worker should report all changes in person status to the MAS Nurse and document the communication according to NDP guidelines and agency policies and procedures.
texts.text: Anytime First Aid is used, some incident has caused a change in the status of the person. The MAC Worker should report all changes in person status to the MAS Nurse and document the communication according to NDP guidelines and agency policies and procedures.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Personal Care vs. Treatments
texts.text: Personal Care vs. Treatments

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Treatments are ordered by a legally authorized prescriber to address a specific problem. It is best practice to transcribe treatments to the MAR and to document completion as ordered.
texts.text: Treatments are ordered by a legally authorized prescriber to address a specific problem. It is best practice to transcribe treatments to the MAR and to document completion as ordered.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Personal care does not require an order from a legally authorized prescriber and is usually a personal preference or comfort measure .
texts.text: Personal care does not require an order from a legally authorized prescriber and is usually a personal preference or comfort measure .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Example #1: Head and Shoulders Shampoo
texts.text: Example #1: Head and Shoulders Shampoo

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Treatment:  Dr. Smith ordered Susie; Head and Shoulders shampoo every other day for excessive dandruff and scalp itching.
texts.text: Treatment:  Dr. Smith ordered Susie; Head and Shoulders shampoo every other day for excessive dandruff and scalp itching.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Personal Care: Susie Sunshine uses head and shoulder shampoo every day because she likes the way it makes her hair feel.
texts.text: Personal Care: Susie Sunshine uses head and shoulder shampoo every day because she likes the way it makes her hair feel.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Example #2: Sunscreen
texts.text: Example #2: Sunscreen

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Treatment:  Dr. Smith ordered to apply sunscreen to Joe before going outside due to skin sensitivity.
texts.text: Treatment:  Dr. Smith ordered to apply sunscreen to Joe before going outside due to skin sensitivity.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ➢ Personal Care: Joe uses sunscreen before going outside because he heard it helps protect him from skin problems.
texts.text: Personal Care: Joe uses sunscreen before going outside because he heard it helps protect him from skin problems.

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: Example #3: Skin Barrier

texts.orig: ➢ Personal Care: Apply Destin (or preferred moisture barrier) to Jenny's buttocks after each incontinent episode.
texts.text: Personal Care: Apply Destin (or preferred moisture barrier) to Jenny's buttocks after each incontinent episode.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The Red Cross intervention for choking
texts.text: The Red Cross intervention for choking

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Don't perform the five-and-five method on a child. You should only give a child the Heimlich maneuver.
texts.text: Don't perform the five-and-five method on a child. You should only give a child the Heimlich maneuver.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Send someone to call 9-1-1
texts.text: Send someone to call 9-1-1

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Lean person forward and give 5 back blows with heel of your hand.
texts.text: Lean person forward and give 5 back blows with heel of your hand.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Give 5 quick abdominal thrusts by placing the thumb side of your fist against the middle of the victim's abdomen, just above the navel. Grab your fist with the other hand.
texts.text: Give 5 quick abdominal thrusts by placing the thumb side of your fist against the middle of the victim's abdomen, just above the navel. Grab your fist with the other hand.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Repeat until the object the person is choking on is forced out and person breathes or coughs on his or her own.
texts.text: Repeat until the object the person is choking on is forced out and person breathes or coughs on his or her own.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: https://www.redcross.org/flash/brr/english-html/conscious-choking.asp
texts.text: https://www.redcross.org/flash/brr/english-html/conscious-choking.asp

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Last updated: 1/24/2023
texts.text: Last updated: 1/24/2023

texts.label: text
texts.orig: After removing the object that caused the choking, keep the person still and get medical help . Anyone who is choking should have a medical examination. Complications can occur not only from the choking, but also from the first aid measures that were taken.                                                                                                            Feb 12, 2021
texts.text: After removing the object that caused the choking, keep the person still and get medical help . Anyone who is choking should have a medical examination. Complications can occur not only from the choking, but also from the first aid measures that were taken.                                                                                                            Feb 12, 2021

texts.label: text
texts.orig: https://medlineplus.gov › Medical Encyclopedia
texts.text: https://medlineplus.gov › Medical Encyclopedia

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The complications of choking include throat irritation, throat damage, and death from asphyxiation. After the Heimlich complications such as rib fracture, diaphragm rupture, pneumomediastinum, acute thrombosis of abdominal aortic aneurysm, mesenteric laceration, and traumatic injury of the gastrointestinal tract could occur.
texts.text: The complications of choking include throat irritation, throat damage, and death from asphyxiation. After the Heimlich complications such as rib fracture, diaphragm rupture, pneumomediastinum, acute thrombosis of abdominal aortic aneurysm, mesenteric laceration, and traumatic injury of the gastrointestinal tract could occur.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Anyone who chokes in a ADMH certified agency and the MAC worker has to physically assist the person to dislodge the object shall be immediately follow up with a physician.
texts.text: Anyone who chokes in a ADMH certified agency and the MAC worker has to physically assist the person to dislodge the object shall be immediately follow up with a physician.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: NOTES TO THE MAS NURSE
texts.text: NOTES TO THE MAS NURSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This information must be covered in MAC II Training. The MAS Nurse is expected to build on the following outline to include specifics mandated by the agency's policies and procedures and current CDC guidelines.
texts.text: This information must be covered in MAC II Training. The MAS Nurse is expected to build on the following outline to include specifics mandated by the agency's policies and procedures and current CDC guidelines.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Hand Washing
texts.text: Hand Washing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Hand washing is the number one defense against the spread of disease and infection.
texts.text: Hand washing is the number one defense against the spread of disease and infection.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Before assisting with any care MAC Workers and nurses should properly wash their hands.
texts.text: Before assisting with any care MAC Workers and nurses should properly wash their hands.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Hand washing protects both the person and the staff.
texts.text: Hand washing protects both the person and the staff.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Principles of Infection Control
texts.text: Principles of Infection Control

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Infections are caused by germs.
texts.text: Infections are caused by germs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Germs are all around us, in us, on us, on animals, insects, and plants, in the soil and water.
texts.text: Germs are all around us, in us, on us, on animals, insects, and plants, in the soil and water.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Most germs do not cause illness in healthy people; most of the illnesses caused are mild, i.e., the common cold.
texts.text: Most germs do not cause illness in healthy people; most of the illnesses caused are mild, i.e., the common cold.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A communicable disease can be passed from one person to another.
texts.text: A communicable disease can be passed from one person to another.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · For a communicable or infectious disease to be passed from one person to another, four things must occur:
texts.text: For a communicable or infectious disease to be passed from one person to another, four things must occur:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o A germ must be present.
texts.text: o A germ must be present.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o The germ must have a place to live and grow.
texts.text: o The germ must have a place to live and grow.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o There must be a susceptible host.
texts.text: o There must be a susceptible host.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o There must be a way for the germ to enter the host.
texts.text: o There must be a way for the germ to enter the host.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Removing any one of the four requirements for infection to spread breaks the chain of infection, thus preventing the infection from spreading.
texts.text: Removing any one of the four requirements for infection to spread breaks the chain of infection, thus preventing the infection from spreading.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Once germs leave the body, they must travel from one person to another.
texts.text: Once germs leave the body, they must travel from one person to another.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Germs can travel by direct or indirect contact via
texts.text: Germs can travel by direct or indirect contact via

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o insects
texts.text: o insects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o animals
texts.text: o animals

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o inanimate objects
texts.text: o inanimate objects

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o water
texts.text: o water

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o food
texts.text: o food

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o air
texts.text: o air

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Direct contact is contact between the infected person and the non-infected person.
texts.text: Direct contact is contact between the infected person and the non-infected person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Indirect contact is contact between the infected person and objects in the environment which became contaminated with the germ.
texts.text: Indirect contact is contact between the infected person and objects in the environment which became contaminated with the germ.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Once the germ travels from one person to another, it must enter the body of the noninfected person via
texts.text: Once the germ travels from one person to another, it must enter the body of the noninfected person via

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o swallowing
texts.text: o swallowing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o breathing in
texts.text: o breathing in

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o injection
texts.text: o injection

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o opening in the skin, i.e. cut or scratch
texts.text: o opening in the skin, i.e. cut or scratch

texts.text: HIV - Human Immunodeficiency Virus

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o causes AIDS

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: o attacks the body's immune system

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: HBV - Hepatitis B Virus

texts.text: o Infects the liver

texts.text: o May cause cirrhosis or liver cancer

texts.text: o Viral liver infection

texts.orig: o May have no or mild symptoms
texts.text: o May have no or mild symptoms

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Usually causes cirrhosis and end-stage liver disease
texts.text: o Usually causes cirrhosis and end-stage liver disease

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: How to Break the Chain of Infection
texts.text: How to Break the Chain of Infection

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Look at your habits, lifestyles, and surroundings for things that may promote infection.
texts.text: Look at your habits, lifestyles, and surroundings for things that may promote infection.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Identify things in the infection chain that can be eliminated.
texts.text: Identify things in the infection chain that can be eliminated.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Practice good hand washing and personal hygiene.
texts.text: Practice good hand washing and personal hygiene.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Treat all body fluids as potentially infectious.
texts.text: Treat all body fluids as potentially infectious.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Use personal protective equipment (PPE) such as gloves, masks, and gowns when exposure to infectious agents is possible.
texts.text: Use personal protective equipment (PPE) such as gloves, masks, and gowns when exposure to infectious agents is possible.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Maintain a clean environment.
texts.text: Maintain a clean environment.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Store, defrost and cook foods at the proper temperature.
texts.text: Store, defrost and cook foods at the proper temperature.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Properly dispose of wastes, garbage, and used medical supplies promptly.
texts.text: Properly dispose of wastes, garbage, and used medical supplies promptly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Get protective vaccines and immunizations.
texts.text: Get protective vaccines and immunizations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Persons should be encouraged to wash their hands after using the bathroom and before eating.
texts.text: Persons should be encouraged to wash their hands after using the bathroom and before eating.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Standard/Universal Precautions
texts.text: Standard/Universal Precautions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Treat all body fluids as potentially infected.
texts.text: Treat all body fluids as potentially infected.

texts.orig: · Use precautions designed to prevent the transmission of blood-borne diseases such as HIV, Hepatitis B, and other blood-borne pathogens.

texts.orig: This information must be covered in MAC II Training.
texts.text: This information must be covered in MAC II Training.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Review the agency's seizure management plan. Focus on keeping the persons safe.
texts.text: Review the agency's seizure management plan. Focus on keeping the persons safe.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Seizures
texts.text: Seizures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Seizure disorder is the same as epilepsy.
texts.text: Seizure disorder is the same as epilepsy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Seizures are produced by abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
texts.text: Seizures are produced by abnormal electrical activity in the brain.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Seizures are usually distressing to the person and can be life-threatening.
texts.text: Seizures are usually distressing to the person and can be life-threatening.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Antiseizure or anti-epileptic medications help prevent the abnormal firing of brain cells.
texts.text: Antiseizure or anti-epileptic medications help prevent the abnormal firing of brain cells.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Noncompliance with anti-epileptic medications is a common cause of recurrent seizures.
texts.text: Noncompliance with anti-epileptic medications is a common cause of recurrent seizures.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Seizures commonly occur in persons with mental disorders.
texts.text: Seizures commonly occur in persons with mental disorders.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Some people know before they are about to have a seizure (aura). They may say 'I feel funny' or 'I smell something strange.'
texts.text: Some people know before they are about to have a seizure (aura). They may say 'I feel funny' or 'I smell something strange.'

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · There are several types of seizures. Make staff aware of what type they may see in the agency.
texts.text: There are several types of seizures. Make staff aware of what type they may see in the agency.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The best-known type of seizure is called a grand-mal seizure.
texts.text: The best-known type of seizure is called a grand-mal seizure.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Grand Mal Seizures
texts.text: Grand Mal Seizures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · May cause loss of consciousness.
texts.text: May cause loss of consciousness.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Causes loss of control of body muscles.
texts.text: Causes loss of control of body muscles.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Causes rhythmic jerking motions of the arms, legs, and body.
texts.text: Causes rhythmic jerking motions of the arms, legs, and body.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · May cause loss of bowel and/or bladder functions.
texts.text: May cause loss of bowel and/or bladder functions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · May cause irregular breathing pattern
texts.text: May cause irregular breathing pattern

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: MAC Worker Responsibilities
texts.text: MAC Worker Responsibilities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Stay with the person .
texts.text: Stay with the person .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Protect the person's privacy.
texts.text: Protect the person's privacy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Protect the person from injury during a seizure.
texts.text: Protect the person from injury during a seizure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Observe the time started and ends.
texts.text: Observe the time started and ends.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Never put your hands, fingers, or any object in the mouth of a person having a seizure.
texts.text: Never put your hands, fingers, or any object in the mouth of a person having a seizure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Call your MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Call your MAS Nurse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Remove all potentially harmful objects.
texts.text: Remove all potentially harmful objects.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Protect the person's head from any injury.
texts.text: Protect the person's head from any injury.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Do not hold any part of the person down.
texts.text: Do not hold any part of the person down.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If possible, place a person on their side during a seizure: if not during then promptly after the seizure.
texts.text: If possible, place a person on their side during a seizure: if not during then promptly after the seizure.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A change in the number of seizures is important. Notify your MAS Nurse of any change in the number and/or intensity of seizures for a person.
texts.text: A change in the number of seizures is important. Notify your MAS Nurse of any change in the number and/or intensity of seizures for a person.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Non-compliance with seizure medication is a common reason people have more seizures. Notify your MAS Nurse any time a person is non-compliant with medications.
texts.text: Non-compliance with seizure medication is a common reason people have more seizures. Notify your MAS Nurse any time a person is non-compliant with medications.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · A new onset seizure for persons who have no history of seizure is a medical emergency. Follow the agency's seizure protocol and call your MAS Nurse.
texts.text: A new onset seizure for persons who have no history of seizure is a medical emergency. Follow the agency's seizure protocol and call your MAS Nurse.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Documentation of a Seizure
texts.text: Documentation of a Seizure

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Note and document the time the seizure begins and ends.
texts.text: Note and document the time the seizure begins and ends.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Describe what occurred, what the person was doing, and what the person looked like.
texts.text: Describe what occurred, what the person was doing, and what the person looked like.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Document all information required by your agency's seizure management policies and procedures including the time you call your MAS Nurse.
texts.text: Document all information required by your agency's seizure management policies and procedures including the time you call your MAS Nurse.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Indications and Usage for Naloxone Auto-Injector
texts.text: Indications and Usage for Naloxone Auto-Injector

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Naloxone Auto-Injector is an opioid antagonist indicated for the emergency treatment of known or suspected opioid overdose, as manifested by respiratory and/or central nervous system depression in adults and pediatric patients.
texts.text: Naloxone Auto-Injector is an opioid antagonist indicated for the emergency treatment of known or suspected opioid overdose, as manifested by respiratory and/or central nervous system depression in adults and pediatric patients.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Naloxone Auto-Injector is intended for immediate administration as emergency therapy in settings where opioids may be present.
texts.text: Naloxone Auto-Injector is intended for immediate administration as emergency therapy in settings where opioids may be present.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Naloxone Auto-Injector is not a substitute for emergency medical care.
texts.text: Naloxone Auto-Injector is not a substitute for emergency medical care.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: INFORMATION ON HOW TO ADMINISTER NALOXONE
texts.text: INFORMATION ON HOW TO ADMINISTER NALOXONE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Naloxone can be administered in a couple of different ways:
texts.text: Naloxone can be administered in a couple of different ways:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. By spraying the medicine into the nose (intranasal or IN administration)
texts.text: By spraying the medicine into the nose (intranasal or IN administration)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. By auto-injector; a pre-filled, ready-to-use dose of the medication is administered simply by pressing the medicine against a person's upper leg (intramuscular or IM)
texts.text: By auto-injector; a pre-filled, ready-to-use dose of the medication is administered simply by pressing the medicine against a person's upper leg (intramuscular or IM)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (1) Naloxone administration via nasal spray (Luer-lock nasal atomizer):
texts.text: Naloxone administration via nasal spray (Luer-lock nasal atomizer):

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ADMINISTERING NARCAN NASAL SPRAY · Remove Narcan Nasal Spray from the box · Peel back the tab to remove the device from the packaging · Hold the Narcan Nasal Spray with your thumb on the bottom, middle and index finger on either side of the nozzle PEEL PLACE PRESS · Tilt the person's head back and support their neck with your hand · Insert the tip of the nozzle into 1 nostril until your fingers on either side of the nozzle are against the bottom of the person's nose
texts.text: ADMINISTERING NARCAN NASAL SPRAY · Remove Narcan Nasal Spray from the box · Peel back the tab to remove the device from the packaging · Hold the Narcan Nasal Spray with your thumb on the bottom, middle and index finger on either side of the nozzle PEEL PLACE PRESS · Tilt the person's head back and support their neck with your hand · Insert the tip of the nozzle into 1 nostril until your fingers on either side of the nozzle are against the bottom of the person's nose

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Press the plunger firmly to give the dose of Narcan Nasal Spray · Remove Narcan Nasal Spray from the nostril · Call 911 and place the person in the recovery position · Repeat the dose using the 2nd nasal spray in 2 to 3 minutes in the other nostril if the person does not respond.
texts.text: Press the plunger firmly to give the dose of Narcan Nasal Spray · Remove Narcan Nasal Spray from the nostril · Call 911 and place the person in the recovery position · Repeat the dose using the 2nd nasal spray in 2 to 3 minutes in the other nostril if the person does not respond.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Naloxone administration with the Evzio auto-injector:

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: On April 3, 2014, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved the Evzio auto injector for nonclinical settings. This device is ready to use. A single dose of naloxone is administered with a retractable needle. Accidental needle sticks are avoided, and the device is easy to use. You do not have to fill a needle or attach a cartridge or nasal piece. It also has a voice recording that tells you step-by-step how to administer the naloxone. (Note: Make sure you push hard-until you hear the voice again- when the device is placed on the person's thigh)
texts.text: On April 3, 2014, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved the Evzio auto injector for nonclinical settings. This device is ready to use. A single dose of naloxone is administered with a retractable needle. Accidental needle sticks are avoided, and the device is easy to use. You do not have to fill a needle or attach a cartridge or nasal piece. It also has a voice recording that tells you step-by-step how to administer the naloxone. (Note: Make sure you push hard-until you hear the voice again- when the device is placed on the person's thigh)

texts.orig: · If lifting or transfer assistance is required, proper positions and other risk management issues ( whom to contact in case of an employee injury ) should be reviewed. At a minimum review the following:
texts.text: If lifting or transfer assistance is required, proper positions and other risk management issues ( whom to contact in case of an employee injury ) should be reviewed. At a minimum review the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o MAS Nurse's expectations/Person needs.
texts.text: o MAS Nurse's expectations/Person needs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Review the four points of safe lifting:
texts.text: o Review the four points of safe lifting:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Keep your head up, and back straight, and bend your knees.
texts.text: Keep your head up, and back straight, and bend your knees.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Bring the load close to the body.
texts.text: Bring the load close to the body.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Stagger the stance (one foot slightly ahead of the other), feet shoulderwidth apart with toes pointed outward.
texts.text: Stagger the stance (one foot slightly ahead of the other), feet shoulderwidth apart with toes pointed outward.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ Don't twist; change the position of your feet to change direction (pivot).
texts.text: Don't twist; change the position of your feet to change direction (pivot).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Test the person's weight before lifting; if the weight is too heavy find another person or mechanical lift (Requires physician's order and requires 2-person use).
texts.text: o Test the person's weight before lifting; if the weight is too heavy find another person or mechanical lift (Requires physician's order and requires 2-person use).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Communicate plan and/or seek assistance from the person before initiating the lift.
texts.text: o Communicate plan and/or seek assistance from the person before initiating the lift.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: o Encourage stretching at work to prevent back injury.
texts.text: o Encourage stretching at work to prevent back injury.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: REMEMBER: INFECTION CONTROL AND EQUIPMENT GO HAND IN HAND. Medical supplies and equipment must be disinfected routinely and documented.
texts.text: REMEMBER: INFECTION CONTROL AND EQUIPMENT GO HAND IN HAND. Medical supplies and equipment must be disinfected routinely and documented.

texts.text: THE MAS NURSE SHALL COMPLETE A MINIMUM OF EIGHT HOURS OF DOCUMENTED MAC II TRAINING

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. If the MAS Nurse begins to work at an agency where the NDP has already been initiated; the following must occur:
texts.text: If the MAS Nurse begins to work at an agency where the NDP has already been initiated; the following must occur:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Verification of successful completion of six courses of MAC I training (Review MAC Files for documentation of certificates from MAC I Training).
texts.text: Verification of successful completion of six courses of MAC I training (Review MAC Files for documentation of certificates from MAC I Training).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Verification of successful completion of eight hours of MAC II Training (Review MAC Files for documentation of certificate signed by a MAS Nurse verifying successful completion of eight hours of MAC II Training AND documentation of skills check sheets for skills delegated).
texts.text: Verification of successful completion of eight hours of MAC II Training (Review MAC Files for documentation of certificate signed by a MAS Nurse verifying successful completion of eight hours of MAC II Training AND documentation of skills check sheets for skills delegated).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · The new MAS Nurse must verify the competency of ALL skills/tasks delegated -  this involves the observation of the successful performance of all skills to be delegated by the new MAS nurse OR the new MAS nurse shall use nursing judgment to accept the verification of competency of the previous MAS nurse. The new MAS nurse verifies the competency of the MAC Worker's ability to complete a med pass or perform any other nursing tasks (vital signs, finger sticks, nebulizer treatments, etc.) that will be delegated by the new MAS nurse.
texts.text: The new MAS Nurse must verify the competency of ALL skills/tasks delegated -  this involves the observation of the successful performance of all skills to be delegated by the new MAS nurse OR the new MAS nurse shall use nursing judgment to accept the verification of competency of the previous MAS nurse. The new MAS nurse verifies the competency of the MAC Worker's ability to complete a med pass or perform any other nursing tasks (vital signs, finger sticks, nebulizer treatments, etc.) that will be delegated by the new MAS nurse.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ABN REGULATIONS
texts.text: ABN REGULATIONS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-2-.06(6) Delegation - the act of authorizing a COMPETENT individual to perform selected nursing activities supportive to /s in selected situations while retaining the accountability for the outcome if the delegation is to an unlicensed individual.
texts.text: 610-X-2-.06(6) Delegation - the act of authorizing a COMPETENT individual to perform selected nursing activities supportive to /s in selected situations while retaining the accountability for the outcome if the delegation is to an unlicensed individual.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-6-.03(5) The RN/LPN shall be responsible for monitoring and evaluating the quality of patient care delivered by personnel under individual nurses' supervision.
texts.text: 610-X-6-.03(5) The RN/LPN shall be responsible for monitoring and evaluating the quality of patient care delivered by personnel under individual nurses' supervision.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-6-.03(17)  The  RN/LPN  shall  accept  individual  responsibility  and accountability for the proper delegation of nursing care activities to other healthcare workers
texts.text: 610-X-6-.03(17)  The  RN/LPN  shall  accept  individual  responsibility  and accountability for the proper delegation of nursing care activities to other healthcare workers

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-6-.03(18) The RN/LPN assesses individual competency when assigning selected components of nursing care to other health care workers including but not limited to the following:
texts.text: 610-X-6-.03(18) The RN/LPN assesses individual competency when assigning selected components of nursing care to other health care workers including but not limited to the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience
texts.text: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Complexity of assigned tasks
texts.text: (b) Complexity of assigned tasks

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Health status of the patient
texts.text: (c) Health status of the patient

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-6-.11(3) The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall delegate only after considering various factors including but not limited to the following:
texts.text: 610-X-6-.11(3) The MAS RN/MAS LPN shall delegate only after considering various factors including but not limited to the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience of the person receiving the delegation
texts.text: (a) Knowledge, skills, and experience of the person receiving the delegation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Complexity of the delegated tasks
texts.text: (b) Complexity of the delegated tasks

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Health status of the patient
texts.text: (c) Health status of the patient

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-7-.11(4) Tasks delegated to unlicensed assistive personnel may not include tasks that require the following:
texts.text: 610-X-7-.11(4) Tasks delegated to unlicensed assistive personnel may not include tasks that require the following:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) The exercise of independent nursing judgment or intervention
texts.text: (a) The exercise of independent nursing judgment or intervention

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Invasive or sterile procedures
texts.text: (b) Invasive or sterile procedures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) The assistance with medications except as provided in Chapter 610X-7
texts.text: (c) The assistance with medications except as provided in Chapter 610X-7

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-7-.06(1) The MAS RN/MAS LPN who provides care in residential community mental health programs certified by the ADMH is accountable and responsible for the nursing care delivered to patients in those settings.
texts.text: 610-X-7-.06(1) The MAS RN/MAS LPN who provides care in residential community mental health programs certified by the ADMH is accountable and responsible for the nursing care delivered to patients in those settings.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ▪ 610-X-7-.06(2) The MAS RN/MAS LPN who provides nursing care in the residential community mental health setting, and community extensions including day habilitation programs, may delegate specific limited tasks to designated unlicensed assistive personnel.
texts.text: 610-X-7-.06(2) The MAS RN/MAS LPN who provides nursing care in the residential community mental health setting, and community extensions including day habilitation programs, may delegate specific limited tasks to designated unlicensed assistive personnel.

texts.orig: 2. If the MAS Nurse begins to work at an agency where the NDP has NOT already been initiated; the following must occur:

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Changes in mental status may indicate exacerbation of the current diagnosis or the development of a new, undiagnosed mental or physical problem. Obvious changes in a person's mental status must be immediately reported to the MAS Nurse. The chart below may be used by the MAC Worker to identify possible changes in mental status.

texts.text: Changes in Behavior

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Changes in behavior may indicate exacerbation of the current diagnosis or the development of a new, undiagnosed mental or physical problem. Obvious changes in a person's behavior must be immediately reported to the MAS Nurse. The chart below summarizes possible behavior changes as 'WILL NOT/CAN NOT', i.e., will not/cannot walk, will not/cannot talk, will not/cannot eat, and will not wake up.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Development of the 'Do Not Use' List
texts.text: Development of the 'Do Not Use' List

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In 2001, The Joint Commission issued a Sentinel Event Alert on the subject of medical abbreviations. A year later, its Board of Commissioners approved a National Patient Safety Goal requiring accredited organizations to develop and implement a list of abbreviations not to use. In 2004, The Joint Commission created its 'Do Not Use' List to meet that goal. In 2010, NPSG.02.02.01 was integrated into the Information Management standards as elements of performance 2 and 3 under IM.02.02.01.               9/18
texts.text: In 2001, The Joint Commission issued a Sentinel Event Alert on the subject of medical abbreviations. A year later, its Board of Commissioners approved a National Patient Safety Goal requiring accredited organizations to develop and implement a list of abbreviations not to use. In 2004, The Joint Commission created its 'Do Not Use' List to meet that goal. In 2010, NPSG.02.02.01 was integrated into the Information Management standards as elements of performance 2 and 3 under IM.02.02.01.               9/18

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Common Dosage Forms
texts.text: Common Dosage Forms

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Tablet - Hard compressed medication in round, oval or square shape. Not all oral tablets are swallowed. Available in fast-acting, slow-release, controlled-release, enteric-coated, film-coated, sublingual, chewable, and other formulations.
texts.text: Tablet - Hard compressed medication in round, oval or square shape. Not all oral tablets are swallowed. Available in fast-acting, slow-release, controlled-release, enteric-coated, film-coated, sublingual, chewable, and other formulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Sublingual tablets are placed under the tongue
texts.text: Sublingual tablets are placed under the tongue

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Wafers/lozenge is placed on the tongue
texts.text: Wafers/lozenge is placed on the tongue

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Buccal tablets are placed between the cheek and the gum
texts.text: Buccal tablets are placed between the cheek and the gum

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Oral dissolving tablet (ODT) placed on the tongue (examples: Zofran, Zyprexa Zydis) No liquids for 5 minutes after administration.
texts.text: Oral dissolving tablet (ODT) placed on the tongue (examples: Zofran, Zyprexa Zydis) No liquids for 5 minutes after administration.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Some have an enteric coating or other types of coatings, which delay the release of the drug and cannot be crushed or chewed .
texts.text: Some have an enteric coating or other types of coatings, which delay the release of the drug and cannot be crushed or chewed .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For a list of medications that cannot be crushed go to: https://denalirx.com
texts.text: For a list of medications that cannot be crushed go to: https://denalirx.com

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. Capsule - Medication in a gelatin container. The capsule may be hard or soft and dissolves quickly in the stomach
texts.text: Capsule - Medication in a gelatin container. The capsule may be hard or soft and dissolves quickly in the stomach

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. Liquid - Different types of liquid medications:
texts.text: Liquid - Different types of liquid medications:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · solutions - two or more substances mixed and uniformly dispersed in a liquid
texts.text: solutions - two or more substances mixed and uniformly dispersed in a liquid

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · suspensions - dispersion of fine solid particles in a liquid; must be shaken before assisting with administration
texts.text: suspensions - dispersion of fine solid particles in a liquid; must be shaken before assisting with administration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · syrup - thick, sweet, a liquid used to convey oral meds (may cause blood sugar to increase)
texts.text: syrup - thick, sweet, a liquid used to convey oral meds (may cause blood sugar to increase)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · elixir - a sweetened solution of a drug in alcohol and water (may cause blood sugar to increase; may interact with other meds; may be contraindicated for persons with substance disorders)
texts.text: elixir - a sweetened solution of a drug in alcohol and water (may cause blood sugar to increase; may interact with other meds; may be contraindicated for persons with substance disorders)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Suppository - small solid medicated mass, usually cone-shaped.  Suppositories melt at body temperature. Refrigerate as directed by the manufacturer. Suppositories may be administered by the rectum or vagina.
texts.text: Suppository - small solid medicated mass, usually cone-shaped.  Suppositories melt at body temperature. Refrigerate as directed by the manufacturer. Suppositories may be administered by the rectum or vagina.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. Inhalant - medication carried into the respiratory tract through the vehicles of air, oxygen, or steam. Inhalants may be used orally or nasally.
texts.text: Inhalant - medication carried into the respiratory tract through the vehicles of air, oxygen, or steam. Inhalants may be used orally or nasally.

texts.orig: 6. Topical - applied directly to the skin surface. Topical medications include the following:

table_cells.text: Delegation is the act of authorizing a COMPETENT individual to perform SELECTED nursing activities supportive to RN/LPN in SELECTED situations while retaining accountability for the outcome if the delegation is to an unlicensed individual.
The RN/LPN shall be accountable and responsible for the delegation of SELECTED nursing situations tounlicensed individuals.
The RN/LPN who provides care in residential community mental health programs certified by ADMHis accountable and responsible for the nursing care delivered to patients in those settings.

RN/LPN who provides nursing care in the residential community mental health setting and community extensions including day hab programs, may delegate SPECIFIC LIMITED TASKS TO DESIGNATED unlicensed personnel.

The RN is accountable for determining the tasks that may be safely performed by the unlicensed assistive personne l in residential community mental health settings following appropriate training and demonstration of competency.

table_cells.text: Basic Medication Information and Medical Terminology
A. States common medical abbreviations and meanings.
The staff can match common medical abbreviations with their meaning and knows the location of a list of abbreviations and meanings when needed. Sent to ABN
B. Describe common dosage forms of medication and routes of administration.
The staff can state the common forms and routes of medication. FORMS ROUTES • Tablet PO • Capsule • Liquid • Suppository rectal/vaginal • Inhalant
C. 1st check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the following 7 rights.
Using the 7 Rights of Medication Administration staff will complete the 1 st check. • Right person • Right medication • Right time • Right dose • Right route • Right reason
2 nd check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the following 7 rights.
Using the 7 Rights of Medication Administration staff will complete the 2 nd check. • Right person • Right medication • Right time • Right dose • Right route • Right reason

grid.text: Basic Medication Information and Medical Terminology
A. States common medical abbreviations and meanings.
The staff can match common medical abbreviations with their meaning and knows the location of a list of abbreviations and meanings when needed. Sent to ABN
B. Describe common dosage forms of medication and routes of administration.
The staff can state the common forms and routes of medication. FORMS ROUTES • Tablet PO • Capsule • Liquid • Suppository rectal/vaginal • Inhalant
C. 1st check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the following 7 rights.
Using the 7 Rights of Medication Administration staff will complete the 1 st check. • Right person • Right medication • Right time • Right dose • Right route • Right reason
2 nd check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the following 7 rights.
Using the 7 Rights of Medication Administration staff will complete the 2 nd check. • Right person • Right medication • Right time • Right dose • Right route • Right reason

table_cells.text: 3rd check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the 7 rights.
Using the 7 Rights of Medication Administration staff will complete the 3rd check. • Right person • Right medication • Right time • Right dose • Right route • Right reason • Right documentation
D. Describes what constitutes a medication error.

The staff can describe or give an example of a med error related to the 7 Rights The staff can explain the agency's policy/procedure related to med errors: • recognize error • action in response - notifications, forms, observations
E. Describes a person's rights related to refusal, privacy, and respect.

The staff can describe what he/she would do to facilitate and comply with the person's right to refuse treatment/meds, right to privacy and right to be treated with respect. Refusal - the person has the right to refuse meds; should not be forced to take meds; review the agency's policy and procedure regarding notifications. Privacy - Knock on closed doors before entering; do not discuss meds in the presence of others. Respect - Address the person by their name; explain what you are planning before doing it; answer questions asked.
F. Defines a medication allergy and signs of a possible allergic reaction.

The staff can state the definition of a med allergy and give examples of symptoms of an allergic reaction. Med Allergy - a reaction occurring as the result of unusual sensitivity to a med/substance; maybe life-threatening symptoms: rash, itching, trouble breathing

grid.text: 3rd check of Medication Administration. This step includes identifying the person and matching the medication label against theMAR utilizing the 7 rights.

Privacy - Knock on closed doors before entering; do not discuss meds in the presence of others. Respect - Address the person by their name; explain what you are planning before doing it; answer questions asked.

The staff can state the definition of a med allergy and give examples of symptoms of an allergic reaction. Med Allergy - a reaction occurring as the result of unusual sensitivity to a med/substance; maybe life-threatening symptoms: rash, itching, trouble breathing

table_cells.text: L. Performs tasks satisfactorily. Verifies med was taken/administered.
The staff is to demonstrate/verbalize checking to ensure meds are swallowed by offering sufficient fluids and/or asking the person to their mouth and lift their tongue when applicable.
M. Returns med to proper storage.

The staff is to ensure the medication container is clean and dry before returning the medication to the proper storage; meds are to be locked and/or double locked per Alabama State Law and the Agency policy and procedures; Staff shall always have direct observation of the meds when they are not locked. (Discuss if the pharmacy label is on a box that contains a bottle of meds i.e., eye drops or ear drops).
N. Documents appropriately on the MARor using the EHR.
Document on the MAR/EHR after the meds are given; follow agency policy and procedures regarding how to document meds refused, held, NPO, sent with the person on leave, controlled substances, etc.
O. Wash hands between medication administration
O. State name and location of med references/resources available in the facility to reference potential adverse effects.

The staff can state the location of med references/ resources i.e., location of potential adverse effects/medication reactions, Quick Facts MACs (VS checklist, abbreviations& meanings, measurement tips, med errors), a posted contact info for the MAS Nurse/s On-call schedule, Agency Policy and Procedure, etc.
Section 4 Staff can demonstrate the correct medication application to be delegated
The staff is to perform/demonstrate each step of assisting with various meds in various routes and forms of meds. All forms and routes delegated must be validated by the MAS Nurse.

table_cells.text: The staff shall verbalize the steps to appropriately identify an Emergency, use Emergency Medications, and follow Agency Emergency procedures and documents.
Staff can demonstrate the use of medical equipment used at the Agency as required. Staff states how to properly clean/ disinfect/store equipment
Medication Administration documentation- MAR, SMAR, SMOR, Holds, PRNs, refusals

The staff is to demonstrate the correct way to document all approved NDP/Agency required forms. Competency may be determined by asking questions or by written tests. All questions asked must be documented. THE MAS NURSE SHOULD HAVE A COPY OF EACH APPROVED NDP/AGENCY FORM FOR EACH MAC WORKER DURING MAC II TRAINING.
Narcotics count upon administration, and a shift-to-shift-verification of narcotic
